title: DAOs, Blockchain and Lessons Learned
body:
**Since 2019, I've been investing and building across the blockchain and DAO ecosystem. Here are some things I've learned:**

**Doing good:** Many projects in the ecosystem are focused on leveraging blockchain and DeFi for creating positive socioeconomic value. Projects such as ACRE DAOs, Popcorn and DoinGud are great use cases. 

**Human Interaction:** In spite of all the good willed projects coming out of the ecosystem, most fail to encourage authentic person to person relationship building. You can’t discount the importance of human interaction and relationships.

**Ethics:** Let’s be honest; this ecosystem is riddled with *degens* who are capitalizing on gamified structures to make themselves rich. I don't think cut-throat business practices have a place in Web3.

**Comprehensive Understanding of Business:** Sure, your engineers can code smart contracts. However, does your team have an understanding of the complex employment, IP, corporate and ethical legal framework where these contracts operate? The answer is usually no. This is an integral part in the process. Many DAOs and projects fall short, creating greater weight on the ecosystem as a whole.

**Government:** Many people in the ecosystem are complete anarchists. I'm in favor of working *with* governments to leverage the impact of blockchain innovation.

**Tooling and Design:** How can we onboard the next billion users with fragmented tooling and non intuitive interfaces? The answer is that we can't. We need to focus on designing products so easy to use that even your grandma can participate in on-chain activities. DAOs need better tooling to help them facilitate community management, participation, and growth.

**Organization and Leadership :** One of the biggest drawbacks to DAOs in particular is lack of structure. Thousands of people in a Discord channel won't be as productive as a few well aligned team members. DAOs need structure, organization and clear leadership in order to be successful within their communities and between their communities. 

**Education:** When BrikPay was launched, we set out to be the first company to bring useful smart contracts to the residential construction industry. Our goal was to give both contractors and homeowners security during home renovation with a data powered escrow contract. We underestimate the amount of education needed to onboard contractors / builders and to help them understand the value of the technology. 

The same is true for the ecosystem as it stands today.

My vision is a world where we can leverage blockchain innovation to make society more equitable and accessible to all. Though we have a long way to go, I remain a hopeful optimist.

 
 Pasquale Scaife

title: AMIMA
body:
Hi, my name is Nestor, one of the founders of AMIMA. 
  
 Latin America is a very complex region. Most countries have limited access to dollars and their currencies suffer massive devaluations. The inflation is high, they have limited access to move money out of their home countries, and the majority of people end up being negatively impacted in their finances due to government mandates. 
  
 Crypto has become an alternative for people to have access to move their money as well as park their assets in more stable currencies than their home currencies. The issue lies in that people can get access to crypto and move it around, but they’re limited in how they can convert into fiat for daily use. Most countries are against crypto, so banks won’t touch funds related to this market, making it more difficult for people to cash in or benefit from using both traditional financial systems and decentralized ones. 
  
 Having experienced all of the above, AMIMA is born out of the desire to give access to people in Latin America to better saving and investing solutions. We want to democratize access by giving them: 
  
 1. A portal to open a bank account in the United States in USD. It will be with a regulated bank, so any transactions clients use from this institution won’t cause them problems with their local banks since it’s not a crypto exchange 
  
 2. Mechanism to receive crypto in their wallets and convert to fiat, as well as buy crypto in an easy way 
  
 3. They can send money to this account via wire transfer, crypto or debit/credit card, giving them multiple options to access dollars and crypto vs their home currencies 
  
 4. As we grow, we want to offer investment opportunities in this growing space through the different partners we work with. Since we have over 40 years combined experience in the financial markets as well as structuring products, we know the key players that create investment solutions to high net worth individuals 
  
 5. Retail clients are usually left wandering around, victim of multiple scams since the solid investments are reserved for wealthy individuals. We aim to change this by doing all of the regulatory heavy lifting on our side, and linking retail clients with better saving and investing options 
  
 We want to start offering a USD savings account where you can receive, buy and sell crypto if needed. We want to connect people to higher yields through different DeFi protocols and investment products, so they can have their money generating a higher yield, in a currency that doesn’t devaluate as the ones they currently use. Since most people have no clue how to use exchanges or manage crypto, we want to simplify the process and make it as easy as using Netflix or Instagram. 
  
 There’s also a big problem in countries like Chile, Peru and Argentina. Governments are unstable, and people are desperate to have assets outside their countries for protection. Their money loses massive value every day, so they are turning into crypto for a way to be able to transact. We have already spoken with different companies that want to work with crypto, but don’t have access to banking outside of their home countries, which we will be able to solve through AMIMA. 
  
 We already have the banking and crypto partners in the United States (all regulated), the company incorporated, relationships with regulated asset managers that structure investment products, tech team to develop both the mobile and desktop app, as well as the potential clients (both individuals and corporations), that can use AMIMA as a solution to buy/sell/get paid in crypto, access to a higher yield USD bank account, and US banking to be able to transact as they please and bypass their local restrictions. 
  
 We’ve spent months understanding the different problem areas, and integrating a solution using tech, banking expertise, crypto, defi, and the will to give better access to people to Latin America and connect them to this incredible digital world. 
  
 The problem we currently have is lack of funding. We spent over $50k developing the best set up and framework, but the investors we had interested in funding backed off after Luna and UST crashed since they got scared of the market. Even though we had other protocols and stable coins that we were going to use, the funding is gone and we have everything ready to go but no money to execute. 
  
 The money we want will be used to cover for the banking and tech setup, and have sufficient capital to run for 18 months. This will give us the flexibility to build up something solid in 3-4 months, and then begin onboarding clients. We expect to be profitable 5-6 months after launch, since once we’re active, we already have corporate clients interested in our solutions. The expected transaction volume from them is between $3-$5 million dollars, which will give us sufficient commission revenue to cover our monthly expenses. 
  
 In the event we achieve this rapidly, we will use the capital raised to invest in hiring new team members so help the growth, as well as expand faster into the different Latam countries. We are looking for people that believe in our idea and want to connect this gigantic part of the world with better financial solutions and give access to a region that has enormous growth potential, but is completely underserved in the digital assets space.

title: Eulogy for my Non-Fungible Tokens
body:
![](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/tOPwWf7MfKqp2ga_EoBsiwsj8DW0vwLo1GmC4hDlObMZH6-iThy6wJrHmldb-aVjJs4IDtb-SWWoFBfpM5kCujS2I6OKAEG5Jd_vxg=w600)

Despite its sirenic wiles, Romanticism remains the most poisonous antidote to man’s search for ontological meaning in an absurd world (to Camus’ dismay, anyone has yet to die for it). Our rebellious fathers, themselves the great sons and daughters of the enlightenment, brushed off the creed of rationality and truth to instead worship the sentiments of the individual. Slowly, art became the performative enterprise through which voyeurs announced themselves to the world in hopes of vindication from the goliaths on Olympus. Objective works of beauty and the sublime were discarded in favor of acts of desecration. The treacherous romantics have stolen fire from Prometheus: we have slain the steward of our higher aspirations.

McGoblintown airdropped McGoblin Burgers to goblins today. If anything can count as art, what is the point in trying to achieve that distinction? We are left with the vapid observation that some people look at some things and other people others. The suggestion that art aims to provide objective values and lasting monuments to the human condition and cultural zeitgeist is dismissed out of hand as dependent on an antediluvian conception of the artwork that was washed down the drain of Duchamp’s fountain. The argument is enthusiastically embraced since it appears to liberate people from burdensome notions of culture, telling them that venerable masterpieces can be dismissed without repercussions, that Trolls or literal “pieces of shit” are on par with Azuki and gnomes the equal of Fidenzas, since nothing is better than anything and all aesthetic claims are equally valid outside of the kingdom of god.

*Introibo ad altare Dei.* Glory be to ShitGod, my Lord, my Executioner! Raise me from this wasteland as thou raised NFTs from the dead. Release me from the ineluctable modality of the visible. Purge the infidels from thy domain so that none are left who do not submit to thy scent. Oh, Lord Most High, Creator of desolation, great Harbinger of doom, thou has already triumphed in thy Manichaean struggle against Matt DesLauriers and Tyler Hobbs. I pray thee have mercy on my fallen brethren and listen to my eulogy in silence.

None care any longer that it matters that works of art have a function in relation to you and me. It matters what art you absorb into your life. It matters that we have taste. It matters—the things they carried. If art is to consist of objects of aesthetic interest, aesthetic judgment naturally concerns itself with what you should and should not like. I believe that the should here—even if it is not exactly a moral imperative—has moral weight. There must be no beyond good and evil. It is true, however, that people no longer see works of art as objects of judgment or as expressions of the good life, since there is no distinction between good and bad taste, but only between your taste and my taste.

Imagine now a world in which people show an interest only in literal shit plungers, grotesque gnomes, assplosions, boobbirds and moondicks, or similar phallic symbols lifted from the debris of life and displayed for the sole purpose of theatrical satire or attention because they are (supposedly) anti-establishment “free mints.” This is increasingly the standard fare of recent NFT collections. What would such a world have in common with that of Construction Tokens, Garden Monoliths, or RGBs? How does that portray the NFT space as a whole to adventurous outsiders? What about the new voyager into Web3 who is smothered by the crushing weight of goblin rocks? They will get burned and leave forever while miners laugh from Inferno.

Of course, in this brave new world, we would still have in common 1. the act-in-itself of putting objects on display, and 2. the very fact of our observation of such fecal matter through elevated aesthetic monocles. But, I’m afraid, this would be a world in which not much else is in common. Higher human yearnings for transcendental platonic forms will no longer find their artistic expression in our worldly creations. The noblest masters would no longer make for mankind the sublime images of the absolute. Mounds of rubbish will pile at the headstone of man and the graveyard of the creator eeconomy. *Mors vincit omnia.*

title: A MFIN LEGEND
body:
talk about creating a narrative - this mfer came into the space, shitpost, meme’d everything, engaged w any/everybody, dropped a cc0 project, helped fund them, and then creates an open edition before vanishing like avatar aang. 

## the dismount

for future reference we are discussing sartoshi: 

[https://twitter.com/sartoshi_nft?s=20&t=j4D9hC7LUS2pnFP7ZE3BUg](https://twitter.com/sartoshi_nft?s=20&t=j4D9hC7LUS2pnFP7ZE3BUg)

he’s accomplished something that many ‘leaders’ struggle with - he knew when to let go. the mfer community was built w/o his intervention but his presence still was intertwined w it. (read his intentions here ↓) 

[https://mirror.xyz/sartoshi.eth/QukjtL1076-1SEoNJuqyc-x4Ut2v8_TocKkszo-S_nU](https://mirror.xyz/sartoshi.eth/QukjtL1076-1SEoNJuqyc-x4Ut2v8_TocKkszo-S_nU)

then 6/9 comes around (more memes) & he releases an OE knowing that many ppl were priced out of any of his art, &/or the official mfer project - a farewell for anyone who wanted to say goodbye + a nice parting gift while his ‘stock’ was at it’s highest.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/858NMJyBj9X_7eytZIWKa.jpg?height=600&width=600)

it’s truly ‘poetic’ and it is the bow tie on a story that spreads a wonderful message:

* don’t take everything so serious 
* laughter is healing 
* create w/e u want 
* help ppl out 
* don’t be greedy 
* memes are crucial 
* know when it’s time to move on 

## enjoyooorism 

if u didn’t have any capital invested in the mfer world then this could all be meaningless, but as a fellow ‘leader’ it is a breath of fresh air. it is a reminder that u can do this thing however u see fit, and as long as u are a ‘reasonable’ person others will come support u. 

he could have run his account for YEARS. he could have done multiple OE’s, more projects, more airdrops, a cash grab or two, etc… he could have ‘stayed around long enough to see himself become the villain’. 

instead he made sure that the ending of his ‘journey’ was the way he wanted & that it ended on a high note - reminds me of Khabib Nurmagomedov retiring unbeaten. 

## fin

i’ve no doubt that if sartoshi really is gone into the night that everything mfer related will become crypto legacy - the legend will outlive him and everyone who was around for it will feel bolstered by witnessing it

what a mfing legend

title: The Story of Monochromatic Stories
body:
We have all heard about Grimm Stories when we were growing up, I am sure. Even if you didn’t know the name of the authors, you’ve probably heard about these unsettling cautionary tales. I don’t exactly know how these stories are cautionary, as they end very absurdly. Before we delve into this particular story, let me tell you a bit about myself as this is the first post ever.

✤

My name is Candan. It means “sincere” in Turkish. My parents raised me to be sincere just as our family name because that was the only way for my family. The one thing that lacked in my childhood was the encouragement to become an artist. Unfortunately in my country, artists don’t make enough money and I always had to keep that in mind. I remember drawing doodles on my desk when I was still at school and I knew that every day, they would be cleaned by the staff. The next morning it was all gone, and I drew again. It quickly became an art form for me; creating, even though you knew your creation would be erased eventually. This was a story for me, I liked the fact that what I created was going to be erased, not seen by anyone at all. Maybe the cleaning staff, but I’m sure they didn’t care, after cleaning hundreds of desks.

✤

I discovered myself again in this world thanks to Web3. A couple of years ago, I had Tumblr, Instagram, and all kinds of Web2 tools to share my works with people. I don’t know why, but life got to me so I never did. After studying Web3 and NFTs I finally had the courage to share my creations with people. I was amazingly lucky that my works have been discovered by people quickly. Oh please don’t judge me when I say quickly, it actually took 6 months for me to make it. Many of my friends who got into NFTs talk about how they can’t be seen by people, please wait. Keep on creating. Ok, this is another day’s topic!

I started to share my doodles in my first collection called “Non-Fungible Doodles” on Foundation. The pieces in that collection didn’t have a particular subject in mind. I was just creating whatever I had in my mind, without thinking much about it. You know they call the first collection “the genesis collection” in this world. My genesis collection is about the entrance to this world. My genesis piece is “Non-Fungible Dreams” and is about me and all the things I had in my dreams.

![Non-Fungible Dreams on Foundation
](https://f8n-production-collection-assets.imgix.net/0xc3659D695E4fA600479B6D68499d659B7A8B786b/1/nft.png?q=80&auto=format%2Ccompress&cs=srgb&max-w=1680&max-h=1680)

I kept following my dreams in this collection. All the other pieces had a different story when I was creating them. Some of them were very emotional and very dear to me, I can’t talk about all of my feelings when I created them here. Again, it’s another day’s topic.

✤

I would like to thank each and every one of my collectors here. Their support and their boost gave me the energy and motivation I needed. So I created my second collection called “Classical Doodles”. I am a sucker for classical oil paintings. I admire them, can stare at them for hours to understand the artist’s emotions. I could never make an oil painting probably… Well, I tried once. Didn’t like what I created. Here is an example 👇

![](https://static.wixstatic.com/media/9608b1_35d1c3cb3bef4823b6edbfb18788c80a\~mv2.png/v1/fill/w_740,h_925,al_c/9608b1_35d1c3cb3bef4823b6edbfb18788c80a\~mv2.png)

So I wanted to combine classical oil paintings with my own doodles. I checked the licensing information and found out that many classical oil paintings are actually copyright free right now. Check them out on this beautiful site: [Artvee](http://artvee.com/)

![](https://f8n-production-collection-assets.imgix.net/0xa2d2C9127B800Ebe27940fC5FeAAB6CE9A210010/4/nft.png?q=80&auto=format%2Ccompress&cs=srgb&max-w=1680&max-h=1680)

I was trying to tell a twisted story with my doodles on these paintings. Since I was a little kid, I always believed that there is a parallel universe. I still watch Fringe after many years the show is finished. In these works of mine, I believed that there is a parallel universe where everybody is free to show their true faces, without the masks we wear every day in our own universe. I mean these masks that I drew on paintings were not masks, but they were people’s real faces actually. We wear different masks every day in accordance with the situations we are in. Should we wear them, or should we show everyone our true faces? I don’t know.

✤

Here I am with Monochromatic Stories now. I love Grimm stories. Didn’t like them much when I was little, but now I enjoy them after a glass of whisky. I mean what is going on really in these stories? How cautionary they are to little children? I don’t know the answers to these questions, but I know that I enjoy them because they make me think about them. I try to find answers to the questions, and I would like to take you on a journey with me to find more questions together. These illustrations are just a different interpretation by me, to get you to the same frequency with me.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/FeP1GR-ZMzRYyvHCTnycX.png?height=5000&width=5000)

Hope you enjoy my little story about me. I felt the need to connect to you through these little posts I make. More to come soon.

Thank you.

✌️

title: Çevre Günü Nedir? Çocuklar İçin Önemi - Arfbot Blog
body:
Çevre günü nedir? Dünya çevre gününün amacı nedir? Sürdürülebilirlik nedir? Sıfır atıkla dünyada neler değişir?

### Çevre Günü Nedir?

Dünyamızda ve ülkemizde Haziran ayının ilk haftası kutlanmaya başlayan, çevre için farkındalık yaratmayı öngören özel bir gündür. 05-11 Haziran tarihleri arasında kutlanır. İlk olarak 1972 yılında, İsveç’in başkenti Stockholm’da yapılan Birleşmiş Milletler Çevre Konferansında alınan bir kararla yürürlüğe girmiştir ve o tarihten itibaren Haziran ayının ilk haftası Dünya Çevre Günü olarak kutlanır.

![](https://blog.arfbot.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/image-18-1024x668.png)

*Çevre*

### Dünya Çevre Gününün Amacı Nedir?

Ülkemizde alınan yeni kararlar doğrultusunda, her yıl 5 Haziran günü “Türkiye Çevre Haftası” olarak kutlanacaktır. Her yıl ‘**Tek bir Dünya**‘ sloganıyla kutlanan Dünya Çevre Günü; sürdürülebilirlik ve daha yeşil dünya vurgusuyla kutlanmaktadır. Dünya genelinde ise Avrupa Birliği’nin, Döngüsel Ekonomi Paketi kapsamında ‘Plastik Stratejisi’ kabul edilmiştir. Bu strateji doğrultusunda; 2030 yılına kadar tüm atıkların geri dönüşümü amaçlanmaktadır. Plastik kullanımını azaltmak da bu amaçlardan biridir.

### Sürdürülebilirlik Nedir?

Sürdürülebilirlik; bireylerin ihtiyaçlarını sürdürülebilir olarak azaltmasını amaçlayan bir yaşam şeklidir. Doğal kaynaklar üzerinde olan olumsuz insan etkisini, en aza indirmek anlamına gelir. Doğal, sosyal ve ekonomik kaynakları doğayla uyumlu bir biçimde yürütme amacını güder. Doğaya saygılı bir yaşam sürmek; sürdürülebilirliğin özelliklerindendir.

![](https://blog.arfbot.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/image-19-1024x683.png)

### Sıfır Atık Nedir?

İsrafı önlemeye ve kaynakların daha verimli kullanılarak atık oluşumunu engellemeye yönelik atık yönetimidir. Sıfır atık verimliliğin artması, maliyetin ve çevresel risklerin azalmasını ve çevre bilincinin oluşmasını sağlar. Birçok alanda oluşan atıkların geri kazanılması gerekir. Atık çıkartmayı azaltma ve atıkları değerlendirme konusunda insanların kazanması gereken bilinç sıfır atıktır.

![](https://blog.arfbot.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/image-20-1024x681.png)

*Sıfır Atık*

Bu “**Çevre Günü Nedir? Çocuklar İçin Önemi**” gibi çocuklar ve ebeveynler için eğlenceli ve yararlı diğer tüm etkinliklere, web sitelerine, uygulamalara, yarışmalara, videolara, haberlere ve oyunlara: [arfbot.com](http://arfbot.com/) üzerinden ulaşabilirsiniz. Tamamen ücretsizdir.

title: One Smpl Trick
body:
9–5 metaverses and weekend metaverses, touch grass metaverses and [touch simulation](https://www.ft.com/content/4be5677b-bc03-4e46-bbbb-68074e8dda6c) metaverses, living metaverses and dying metaverses. With a hypnotic timbre, Mark Zuckerberg tells a story about the world to come that says everything there will be just as it is here. Just as our room is now, so it will be in the world to come; where our baby sleeps now, there too it will sleep in the other world. And the clothes we wear in this world, those too we will wear there. Everything will be as it is now, just differently textured.

The familiarity of variable-poly surfaces, however, belies the novel forms of visuality that animate the metaverse. Beyond the illusory layer of avatars and environments, techniques such as subtle gaze direction exploit research on human visual cognition and attention, while computer vision algorithms are refined by data synthesized using computer graphics. For humans, these new images operate below the threshold of perception; for machines, they provide the foundation of perception. Machine learning models trained on synthetic data, which is diverse and perfectly labeled by design, generalize better than models trained on real data, enabling avatars to represent users in granular detail.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Z0PeTXBZUBO9hyIKVK9T3.jpeg?height=883&width=1365&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&)

SMPLverse NFTs use facial recognition to retrieve data synthesized by Microsoft to train face tracking algorithms for its mixed reality headsets. Like many pfp projects, the Microsoft dataset uses procedural generation to randomly create and render faces without any manual intervention. The images combine a generative 3D face model with a library of artist-created assets—including textures, hair, and clothing—and SMPL, a body mesh used to animate avatars in virtual environments. Although verisimilitude is formally irrelevant to machine learning, it remains the only method of achieving functional equivalence between real and synthetic data.

Visually, the training images suggest identity play, emulating the avatars whose naturalism they are meant to enhance. Their effect, however, is to attune algorithms ever more precisely to users’ physical selves: the dataset expresses how users appear *to* virtual environments as much as how they appear *in* them. The minting process, which matches your own face to a smpl, elaborates the tension between freedom and constraint—even a pool of 100,000 images is too small to produce consistent matches.

The market-driven development of immersive technologies constitutes its own form of vision. By fractionalizing Microsoft’s dataset into NFTs, SMPLverse inverts its function, redistributing the metaverse’s centralized assets through its paradigmatic decentralized property form.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Ua2pugKf_c16nk4xt8MhA.png?height=512&width=1024&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&)

### Details

* There are 511+2 tokens available to mint.
* Each token allows you to submit one image through our webcam interface. Your submitted image will be written to the token as a hash. Our facial recognition model uses this hash to match your image to a smpl.
* When the image is matched, it receives one attribute: confidence. Confidence assesses the likelihood that your image matches the smpl you receive. Confidence is a declining measure: as more smpls are matched, your likelihood of receiving a high confidence match decreases. Conversely, your likelihood of receiving a smpl with stranger visual attributes increases.
* 7 rare smpls have an additional “head pose cluster” attribute, which entitles them each to 4.14% of secondary revenue. These rare smpls form a group of images clustered by head pose. As more rare smpls are matched, the bounds of the cluster will sharpen. To acquire a rare smpl, token holders must recognize the same patterns that a facial recognition system trained on the dataset would be optimized to recognize.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qWWsezFM2rbJ0wyPkWdJQ.jpg?height=288&width=249&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&&)

SMPLverse is launching June 24, 2022 at [smplverse.xyz](https://smplverse.xyz/)

Please check site for local timezones.

Main sale price is 0.2 ETH. Presale price is 0.18 ETH.

Find more details on our [Twitter](https://twitter.com/smplverse) and our [Discord](https://discord.gg/2hWDykfUdq).

title: Top 16's
body:
The main idea is to have a platform to discover up and coming rap artists and also collect rap verses as NFTs by your favorite artists. This could expand to other types of music, comedy, etc. but seems very well suited to start with rap. The music industry was hugely disrupted by P2P software in the past and will be hugely disrupted by P2P software in the near future.

P2P file sharing disrupted music distribution in a major way. This ultimately benefitted smaller artists who could now be heard by a much broader audience. It also let artists bootstrap and build a following much easier before monetizing. P2P tokens will disrupt the monetization channel for artists which should also benefit smaller up and coming artists by allowing them to more easily capture the value of their brand at earlier stages in ways not possible before.

There’s not a lack of talent, but there’s definitely a lack of platforms with great incentives. A platform like the one I’m describing would ideally create more of a meritocracy in which the artists who are valued highest by their fans are the ones rewarded the most. The platform would offer an NFT collection of the best rap lines, 16 bars (30 seconds) max. Audio clip, lyrics and the artists info all displayed on the card. In purchasing an NFT verse fans would own a collectible item that they could display that would play back parts of songs when others interact with it.

The idea is essentially a music platform like TikTok, but for discovering underground rap and supporting your favorite artists as well. This platform would help artists in a huge way with music discovery. TikTok has become one of the main ways people are discovering music now and its even unearthing old bands that haven’t had large popularity in years. This would do something similar for discovery but having ownership in a collectible would add stickiness to the product. Digital cards of rappers with a verse on them could and should be collected like pro athlete cards are.

To create a more authentic experience and mimic actual card collecting, rap verse cards condition could randomly degrade over time. For example, the condition on the back of card might start as mint and after a year and a half could be downgraded to like new condition. This would add another element to look for when collecting verses.

This platform would run on top of an exchange that would start listing NFTs when artists, or anyone who owns the rights to the music, uploads verses from a song. They would then be paid directly when fans buy their NFT cards. Basically, a collectable highlight reel for rap artists.

## 来个总结

* V2卡便宜是吧，好不好用我不知道，我反正也不会买。但从V1和V2卡，这个逼我能在我无聊的时候一直黑他。

title: C r O w｜4/60 “DAO of DAOs”设想及其特性
body:
> A Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) of DAOs

**Wulf A.Kaal**  Professor, University of St. Thomas School of law

### 论文主旨

本文提出“DAO of DAOs”的概念，对其技术架构与治理方案进行设计，旨在揭示DAO of DAOs对整个DAO生态的扩展。

### 主要内容

* DAO的局限：路径依赖、合规的不确定性、次优激励设计、治理与法律设计的实验
* DAO of DAOs：概念、法律结构、治理方案、抗攻击性、去中心化程度

## 一、导言

【DAO的意义/作用】

DAO是一种需求的实体化/提供了一种实例：全球无边界实体协调代理关系、推进预期、限制责任的需求，通过智能合约来实现。

> DAOs instantiate the need for truly global borderless entities that coordinate agency relationships, enforce expectations, and limit liabilities via smart contracts.

【Ethereum】

在2020年，以太坊仍是DAO创建的首要智能合约平台。Solidity与实现了图灵完备的EVM结合，以太坊节点据此维持共识。

但是，以太坊平台的局限在于：交易吞吐量与gas费等，因此为下一代区块链技术与智能合约提供了机会，作者认为：DAO有助于加快这一演进过程。

【DAO的去中心化】

（1）治理中心化是DAO的一大威胁：

中心化加剧则会增加风险：统一的原则被改变或被无视，而去中心化则能够将DAO的治理参与覆盖到系统的边际（the edges of the system）

> Decentralization forces the shared understanding and shared social contract to be of
> primary importance for the life of the organization.

（2）法律中心化是对DAO进化的另一个核心威胁：

DAO是一个基于代码的虚拟组织，任何计算机都可以通过网络接入，现行法律需要为DAO提供一个法律架构，否则如果非要为其在现行的法律辖域中找到合适的位置，则势必要求一个法律实体代表（representative），这会导致DAO变得中心化。

> Only a jurisdiction that gives the DAO limited liability as an entity and accepts its independent status without the need for representation may truly be favorable for DAO concepts.

（3）平台中心化问题

平台中心化会导致开发者失去对他们正在建设的事物的话语权，因此，开发者社区需要有支持，从而更好地各显其能。而DAO与DAOs的网络能够让开发者通过社区共识来决定技术的开发与走向。

> DAO communities have started to introduce healthier
> governance mechanisms that help them grow their influence in technology development.

## 二、DAO的局限性（2020）

### 1、路径依赖

早期DAO对新兴DAO设计的影响，表现为新兴DAO对其的路径依赖（Path Dependencies），共性表现为：DAO的代币持有者以token价值最大化为其共同目标。

> Crow：在这里可以与“股东资本主义”比较：公司制进入金融资本主义时代面临的问题，是否在DAO中同样存在？

**DAO 结构中的绩效评估是基于价值最大化，而不是基于等级或政治过程**

* 好处：代币持有者和contractor具有共同目标，且代币价值与声誉处罚不会受到种族、文化偏见等因素的影响（因为参与者的匿名性以及彼此关系的陌生）

（p.s. 有关什么是contractor，可参见2/60中的描述：contractor可以提交提案，以及与提案相关的部署于区块链上的合约）

* 坏处（与股东资本主义类似）：对同质化代币的价值提升的关注可能会导致**短期主义**，并可能忽略**道德和治理**问题。

路径依赖在DAO的开发者处仍然存在，某个DAO内在的架构和实现路径很大程度上会基于以往的软件方案。

### 2、合规不确定性

> Jurisdictional issues for DAOs include the government’s ability to enforce relevant regulations and DAO accountability through civil liability.

受托责任（fiduciary duties）的法律概念在 DAO 中的应用尚不明朗。

在传统的监管基础设施中，受托责任要求基金经理以其客户的最大利益行事「Patrick Eha and Tanaya Macheel, “What the Attack on the DAO Means for Banks,” American Banker (Jun. 20, 2016) (quoting Kirill Gourov, Expand Research analyst and “early bitcoin adopter”).」。

受托责任通常用于解决与所有权和控制权分离相关的公司治理问题（“委托-代理”）。「Wulf A. Kaal “Blockchain Solutions for Agency Problems in Corporate Governance,” Economic Information to Facilitate Decision Making, ed. Kashi Balachandran (Singapore: World Scientific Publishers, 2019), 23.」

> Traditional regulatory infrastructure that attempts to overcome the corporate governance problems associated with the separation of ownership (shareholders) and control (management) relies heavily on fiduciary duties.

而在 DAO 结构中，工作流程的关注点在于“value-to-effort”（价值与投入比），DAO 代币持有者根据他们独特的技能、背景和训练，根据他们的个性化价值主张（individualized value propositions）共同优化 DAO。

> In the DAO structure such duties and litigation- based control mechanisms are less relevant.

### 3、次优激励设计

DAO 治理在 2020 年代初期缺乏适当的激励设计：大多数 DAO 使用集中形式的主节点来建立区块链协议和 DAO 升级。

人性，还有以制度形式产生的，存在人为介入的机器衍生物（machine derivatives），都需要一种双重激励，从而“overcome attempts of rational and opportunistic internal and external constituents to game the governance design of a given DAO”。

双重激励包括：

**a) 激励行为者提高自身效用，同时 b) 行为者的行为有利于整个机构及其成员的长期利益。**

同样地，2020 年代初的 DAO 设计尚未有效地概念化和应用具有非同质化、去中心化资产的匿名价值标识符。

Merit identifier（价值标识符）而不是个体身份，将有助于解决内部腐败问题：

> Merit identifiers other than individual identity remove the most corruptive influences.

诸如此类，非同质化资产与加权密钥可以成为声誉的会计指标，来克服组织内部的腐败。因为同质化资产被用作DAO治理的主要激励时，精于计算和机会主义的内外部成员有可能破坏DAO的治理设计以谋私利。

### 4、治理与法律设计实验

> Representation requirements are a natural DAO-anchoring mechanism for a given jurisdiction in order to allow the respective jurisdiction to exercise jurisdiction and control over the DAO.

——内部DAO治理与法律外衣结合：DAO的链上治理与现实世界的法律实体互有增益。

<aside>
💡 【DAO与传统公司结构比较】

</aside>

（1）公司的权力结构与DAO的工作形式

* 在传统公司结构中，存在传统等级结构，权力和授权从投资者/股东通过董事会向下流动到管理层，最后是员工。
* 而DAO 通常没有董事、经理或员工。由于一系列智能合约授予 DAO 代币持有者投票权，基于区块链的智能合约模仿了公司章程或章程的作用以及整个“先例系统”。由于 DAO 代码通常是开源的，因此代币持有者不仅对投资和/或工作提案进行投票，而且对代码的任何更改进行投票。接受的提案也将由软件代码支持，定义各个 DAO 与接受和资助的工作提案之间的关系（根据权利、义务和绩效指标）。

（2）社区审计是 DAO 治理的关键要素

* 中心化系统很少提供和管理社区驱动的审计，因为后者会与中心化治理中嵌入的代理和监督原则相龃龉。外部监控和验证是中心化治理系统的关键，因为集中式的结构中的激励设计无法实现廉洁的内部控制。
* 而DAO采用社区审计。DAO 的去中心化性质提高了协调效率，因为系统的用户，即 DAO 成员，通常最了解如何评估其他用户/DAO 成员。去中心化的 DAO 结构在治理设计中实现了前所未有的信息对称性，因为治理信息（即 DAO 群体决策指标和 DAO 治理协议需求）处于去中心化系统的边缘，直接在 DAO 成员之间连续不断地交换和评估，处于可提供动态反馈效果的迭代信息流中。

（3）治理的升级

不同以往的代理关系：智能合约的协调部分取代了传统的基于代理原则的控制机制

> DAO workers are engaged in a dynamic set of working relationships that continuously and dynamically self-organize around projects and outcomes, not corporate hierarchies with implicit hierarchical biases.

## 三、DAO of DAOs

DAO的未来依赖于它们是否有能力创生一个长期有动力的治理系统，让成员以去中心化的方式协作，并公允地重新配置资源（equitably redistribute resources）。

### 概念

DAO 内部治理和外部合法 DAO 设计之间的协同作用可以实现更高水平的去中心化。DAO of DAOs 的内部治理是去中心化的，并且通过声誉质押而有效，因此更有可能创建一种新的内部治理解决方案，后者可以很好得转化为实际法律解决方案。

### 法律结构

双重实体，分别治理

* 内部治理：DAO of DAOs 用声誉代币质押系统，促进了 社区的激励和治理改进
* 外部治理：DAO of DAOs 在现实世界的法律环境中以其法律外衣表示，该法律外衣的目标是建立一个具有扁平化层次结构的去中心化和民主的协会（decentralized and democratic association with flat hierarchies）

DAO of DAOs的二元实体方案，成功的关键在于外部法律外衣（ LEGAL WRAPPER ）对源自DAO of DAOs内部投票结果的广泛尊重，DAO of DAOs的投票权和结果被委托给法律外衣的成员。

DAO of DAOs实现了更高水平的去中心化。因为其内部治理所创建的内部治理解决方案，可以很好地转化为通过 LEGAL WRAPPER 实例化的真实法律解决方案，反之亦然。

### 治理

2020年，链上投票机制在很大程度上仍处于起步阶段：**one-token-one-vote** voting mechanisms

上述结构重新引入了 21 世纪初旧式系统中一股一票设计的许多缺点和次优激励分配，容易产生权力腐败。

* 替代性的方案？

（1）Quadratic Voting（二次投票）

（2）Futarchy: 对价值投票，对赌信念「DAOrayaki」

> Futarchy：是由经济学家罗宾-汉森（Robin Hanson）在2000年提出的新型政府管理模式理论。该理论主张“价值投票，对赌信仰(vote on value, but bet on beliefs )”。包含两层含义：一层为，个人通过股票决定国家是否执行某个政策，转变为对度量标准进行投票。然后由预测市场选择出最合适且最优化度量标准的政策。另一层为，在Futarchy治理中，参与者赢了，便可从中获利，错了就会亏损。这要求参与者将更多的精力集中于提案的本身，收集、研究更多的深度信息而非无关的社交活动。

> 而Futarchy 的参与度一直备受质疑。预测市场是零和博弈。参与者需要付出除预测投票之外的其他成本，这对于参与者而言是不合理的。最终导致参与度很低，市场深度不足，进而专家和分析公司无法从收集信息的过程中充分获利。加之，价值的复杂性、政策的缓慢性，使得Futarchy 并没有在任何一个政府中得到应用，甚至在公司治理中都没有真正的实现。

> 基于DAO的Futarchy 市场（混合形式的Futarchy），更像是一个正和游戏。我们可以将预测市场建模为零供给市场+额外的初始配额，这时参与的门槛将会降低、参与度将会增加。目前典型的应用如：追溯公共物品资助、去中心化预测市场平台Augur、去中心化法庭Kleros。

（3）Liquid Democracy

（4）Conviction Voting

（5）非同质化投票（实例之一即reputation-based voting）

基于声誉的投票：通过质押非同质化资产（e.g. 声誉代币）的方式进行投票

尝试解决同质化代币中的腐败问题：因为第三方不太可能接管非同质化资产，后者通过给定的DAO领域的实际专业知识有机地增长和维持。（即使第三方能够接管或购买非同质化的声誉，也不太可能随着时间的推移维持声誉评分，以及相关的同质化资产收益流（revenue stream）

### 基于声誉的内部治理

DAO of DAOs具有非同质化的、同质化的token两套治理设计：

**NFT：reputation token**

成员可通过声誉代币取得投票权；

通过在投票池中持续参与并做出有价值的贡献获得；

**FT：reputation salary token**

薪酬代币是同质化的算法稳定币，锚定某个资金池或指数；

成员可通过薪酬代币取得收益，依据其非同质化声誉代币的比例；

* 声誉代币的质押机制

个人可以选择质押自己的声誉代币，基于他们所认为的有助于提升整个DAO的声誉与效用进行选择/治理投票，为DAO带来长期、正向的贡献；

为什么说基于非同质化的声誉代币质押鼓励长期主义？因为声誉代币在区块链上是透明、可回溯、可检视（reviewable），一项决策的长期后果可以在未来看到，从而根据难以被第三方接管的NF（R）T来进行动态激励；

为什么说基于非同质化的声誉代币质押能将传统的零和博弈转变为正和博弈？对比如下：

* 传统的方案——单一的同质化代币用于治理，则所有成员的目标就是尽可能多地获得FT，这样的目标往往是为他们自己，而难以兼顾到组织的长远发展；
* 基于声誉代币质押的治理方案/智能合约提案，可以成为precedent（先例）（这里应该可以用英美法系中的判例来理解），如果后续的发展中，某个先例被引用的次数变多，则相应的价值上升；如果某个先例引用走低，提供不了什么参考价值，则往往会有新的先例产生，取而代之，则前者价值也走低；

### **博弈论设计**

1、费用门槛：成为DAO of DAOs成员的准入条件是支付一定的admission fee，使得违规后重新加入的成本上升（对于匿名成员可能会采取黑名单制）；

2、通过对“未来价值超过限值”的允诺来确保连续的合作，声誉代币随着法律外衣增加grants、DAO of DAOs网络；同时——

> Reputation tokens in the DAO of DAOs system are correlated with expected future salarytokens in the LEGAL WRAPPER.

3、在DAO of DAOs的设计中，随着网络规模的增加，削减 DAO 成员声誉的机会损失会增加。DAO 网络越大，用于获得同质化代币工资的声誉代币的竞争就越多。进一步，考虑到由于匿名性增加导致信息不完整，声誉代币的信息价值增加。当潜在的商业伙伴对 DAO 成员身份的了解较少时，对 DAO 成员持有的声誉代币的了解变得更加重要。此外，个人化信息的缺乏（the lack of personal knowledge）鼓励DAO of DAOs的成员更加努力公平地来规范管理声誉代币。

基于声誉代币的Meritocracy是被鼓励的。

> Meritocracy：唯才主义，通常是指一种政治哲学思想，主张权力的分配应根据个人之才能与功绩。在这种体系内，个人的上位与进阶是基于其在该领域内的功绩和经考试检定的智慧天赋。

### 治安与遵守规则

通过合约与算法来对欺诈者进行惩罚，设立基于声誉代币的一系列门槛。

### 权力的公平分配

【中心化权力分配与DAO of DAOs比较】

* 集中式权力分配的影响因素：语言、宗教、种族、物理存在、群体标识符、文化等。同样，在集中式治理中常用的标识符（例如如社交媒体个人资料和信用评分等）对于访问中央系统和资源至关重要；
* DAO 治理设计中，权力更平等的分配将覆盖那些在集中式系统中没有代理权（agency）的选民（constituents）；

### 抗攻击性

通过博弈论设计中的admission fee来提高sockpuppet attacks的成本，通过在onboarding过程中收取一定的费用，来让那些维护系统、抵御DOS攻击的行为有利可图。

### 去中心化程度

（1）是否拥有基于声誉代币的**才能标识符**：merit identifiers,i.e.,DAO of DAOs members merit,knowledge,and influence ismeasured through their respective DAO of DAOs non-fungible reputation token ownership;

（2）加权密钥的**非同质化**，且不可购买或出售：non-fungibility of DAO of DAOs weighted keys,i.e.,merit of a DAO of DAOs member is expressed by a non-fungible weighted keys that cannot be bought or sold;

（3）**公开透明**：full transparency,i.e.,all DAO of DAOs decisions are fully transparent and accessibleby the public and the DAO of DAOs members themselves;

（4）**非直接的经济激励**，而是根据**声誉代币**来支付同质化稳定币：indirect economic incentives,i.e.,DAO of DAOs members are getting paid with stable fungible tokens in proportion to their non-fungible reputation tokens;

（5）决策根据质押声誉代币的**投票**过程作出：decisions in the DAO of DAOs are made with a voting design that revolves around staking of non-fungible reputation tokens;

（6）**同质化薪酬代币锚定价值**：DAO of DAO's fungible salary tokens are designed as stable and EURO denominated cryptocurrencies that is pegged；

（7）DAO of DAOs成员的**匿名性**：DAO of DAOs merit identifiers revolve around reputation scores and members of the DAO of DAOs community can predominantly be identified by their respective reputation score in the DAO of DAOs structure.

## 四、结论

> Decentralized governance is the key feature that enables the evolution of a DAO of DAOs. As the decentralized governance becomes more mainstream, other DAO ecosystems can cooperate with the DAO of DAOs.

title: C r O w｜3/60 DAO概念起源、多元界定及开放讨论
body:
### @crow_wetland

> **Decentralized Autonomous Organization (2021)**

**Samer Hassan** *Harvard University* [shassan@cyber.harvard.edu](mailto:shassan@cyber.harvard.edu)

**Primavera De Filippi** *Harvard University*

### 【DAO概念的界定（特征）】

1、基于区块链 2、通过公链上自动执行的规则来进行协作与治理 3、治理是去中心化的

### 【DAO起源与演进】

（组织理论的传统研究对象）

* 组织理论对去中心化组织诸多形式的研究，可参见Shubik, 1962; Beckhard, 1966; Freeland & Baker, 1975

（IoT系统 & 社会运动的传统DAO概念）

DAO的确切概念被首次提出是在20世纪90年代，在Dilger（1997）的研究里指涉一种物联网环境中的“多元代理系统”（multi-agent systems）；还被用于Schneider（2014）所研究的反全球化社会运动中的非暴力、去中心化行动。

> Crow：Schneider意义上的去中心化自组织DAO，在研究对象上可以联系Castells在《认同的力量》中的反全球化社会运动「认同的力量\[M\].社会科学文献出版社，曼纽尔.卡斯特（ManuelCastells）著，2004」

（区块链语境下的现代DAO概念）

DAC：去中心化自治公司

（1）被早期加密货币爱好者在网络论坛非正式地使用，“去中心化”与“分布式”总是可互换的；

（2）在2013年，被公开讨论(S. Larimer, 2013; D. Larimer, 2013)(Buterin, 2013)；

DAC的主要特性（(S. Larimer, 2013)）

* 通证化、可交易股份（为股东提供分红的媒介）；
* 防腐败（incorruptible）、公开可审计（publicly auditable）；
* 没有人为干预，通过利益相关者电脑上的分布式开源软件运行；

基于上述特性，任何人可以买入公司股票而成为利益相关者（stakeholder），被赋予利润份额、公司成长中的参与权、对公司如何运行的话语权；

**DAO概念的演变**

原因：DAC概念涉及到公司治理，对那些更普遍的区块链应用过于局限，因此出现替代性的定义

例如：去中心化应用（DAPPs） (Johnston, 2013)；去中心化自治组织DAOs (Buterin, 2014)

在本文中，DAO概念目前具体所指的就是“organisations deployed as smart contracts on top of an existing blockchain network”

**DAO早期实践**

在2016年发起的风险投资基金The DAO，它的实验(DuPont, 2017)启发了一众DAOs(e.g., MolochDAO, MetaCartel)，以及推动DAO应用的DAAS模型(e.g. Aragon, DAOstack, Colony or DAOhaus)

**DAO的衍生概念**

去中心化合作组织 Decentralized Collaborative Organization (DCO)：有着更强的合作属性的DAO (Hall, 2015; Schiener, 2015; Davidson, De Filippi, & Potts, 2018)

分布式合作组织 Distributed Cooperative Organization (DisCO)：以合作与民主属性为重中之重的DAO (Troncoso & Ultratel, 2019)

### 【DAO的市场界定】

1. （虚拟实体）“virtual entity that has a certain set of members or shareholders which \[...\] have the right to spend the entity's funds and modify its code”——Buterin, Ethereum white paper (Ethereum, 2013, p. 23)
2. （网络）“a network of stakeholders with no central governing body” ([https://daostack.io](https://daostack.io/))
3. （较为一般的描述）“regulated by a set of automatically enforceable rules on a public blockchain” (<https://aragon.org/dao>)

### 【DAO的学术界定】

（DAO的特性）

> Crow：2018、2019年的定义主要是强调智能合约，但在Arroyo与Hassan于2020年的研究中，对DAO的理解落在“人”，兴许是一种值得关注的转变：DAO概念的泛化过程

1. DAO让人们**在线上协作并自治（self-govern）**【Singh and Kim (2019, p. 119)：DAO是一种基于区块链的新型、可扩展的自组织协作体，由智能合约所控制】，且“组织”一词在这里指一个能让人们围绕**共同目标**而行动的实体，而非合法注册的那种组织 【El Faqir, Arroyo, and Hassan (2020, p. 2)：DAO由在区块链基础设施设立的一系列共同规则下，具有相同目标的人组成】
2. DAO的源代码通过智能合约部署在区块链（通常是**公链**）【Hsieh et al. (2018, p. 2)：DAO应该被部署在公开网络】
3. DAO的智能合约代码具体规定了人们之间代码形式的交互【De Filippi and Hassan (2018, p. 12)：仅由防腐败的一系列规则控制的自治组织】【Reijers, Wuisman, Mannan, De Filippi and colleagues (Reijers et al., 2018) 对DAO治理结构中的链上链下治理进行了区分】
4. DAO的规则由智能合约规定，因此它们独立于任何一方而自主执行【De Filippi & Wright (2018, p. 146)：DAO代表了最先进的自治状态，它作为基于区块链的一种组织，由智能合约、算法与决定性的代码来运行，而非人治或群体共识（group consensus）】
5. DAO的治理应当独立于中心化的控制【Hsieh et al. (2018, p. 2)：DAO是一种非科层制组织，在点对点、密码学保障安全性的公开网络上运行并记录日常任务，在民主决议的程序下，依靠内部利益相关者的自愿贡献进行运营、管理、演进——“**non-hierarchical** organizations that perform and **record routine tasks** on a peer-to-peer, cryptographically secure, **public network**, and rely on the voluntary contributions of their internal stakeholders to operate, manage, and evolve the organization through a **democratic consultation process**”】
6. DAO依靠区块链而存在，因此承继了区块链的部分属性，例如公开透明，密码学的安全性，去中心化【Beck (2018, p. 57)：DAO是一个在彼此独立的参与者间去中心化、透明且安全的运作与治理系统】

### 【现有的Open Discussion】

* 对基于区块链的商业模型的研究，例如DEX (Lin et al., 2019; Bansal et al., 2019)
* 对基于市场的平台，例如预测市场（prediction markets）(Clark et al., 2014) 的研究，这类市场以去中心化组织、自动治理（automated governance）的方式运行 (Jentzsch, 2016; Singh & Kim, 2019)

在本文中，作者指出：DAO可以用于创建一个虚拟实体，成为众筹募资平台、共享单车平台、全自动公司、全自动决策制定设施等……DAO不是某个具体的商业模型或组织类型，而是一个**概念**，可以被用于指涉更广泛的事物（refer to a wide variety of things）

> Crow：在此也反映了上文所提到的DAO概念的普适性应用

* 对基于区块链的去中心化组织在经济与治理上的新机遇的研究(Davidson et al., 2016, 2018; Sims, 2019; Rikken et al., 2019; Kaal, 2020)
* 对DAO法律议题的研究，包括理论角度 (De Filippi & Wright, 2018; Reijers et al.. 2018)与实践角度 (Rodrigues, 2018; Werbach, 2018; Riva, 2019)
* 在政治学领域对现存区块链社区（communities）的研究(Scott, 2015; Swartz, 2017; DuPont, 2019)
* DAO可被用于更进一步的经济与政治去中心化（economic and political decentralisation），且是藉由一种更民主、更具参与性的治理形式（democratic and participatory form of governance）(Swan, 2015; Atzori, 2015; Allen et al., 2017; Tapscott & Tapscott, 2017)
* DAO的公共研究发生了某种转变：原先将DAO描述为一种针对治理的技术解决方案 (Jentzsch, 2016; Voshmgir, 2017)，但现在更多在讨论**DAO如何改变经济与政治治理的属性（nature）**(Davidson et al., 2016; Beck et al., 2018; Zwitter & Hazenberg, 2020; De Filippi et al., 2020)

### 【有待解决的问题】

### 1、DAO的“去中心化”

是仅需要建立在基础设施层（底层区块链网络），还是同样需要应用在治理层（例如是否应该被中心化行动者控制）？

### 2、DAO的“自治”

DAO是否必须完全自治化（fully autonomous and fully automated），没有人为干预，抑或“自治”概念（例如原先对自治的要求：一个DAO需要它的成员参与，它的治理不应该依赖一小部分行动者）是否应该被弱化？

### 3、DAO的“组织”

行动者与智能合约交互的“community”，是否可以被承认为一个“组织”(independently of any legal recognition)？具体来说：与智能合约发生的交易行为，是否可以被认为是一种组织性的行动（organisational activity）？以及，是否需要更深程度的involvement，例如拥有一个**治理模型**或**参与者间的集体互动**？

title: C r O w｜5/60 DAO与组织管理理论：两个问题
body:
Crow按：本文的参考价值在于两个问题：如何从管理学角度对DAO进行界定？DAO在管理理论中处于何种位置？因此笔记的内容较短。

> 专题研究 Feature：道可道，非常DAO——论道“DAO组织管理”

张东向 蔡茂华

一、如何在管理学角度对DAO进行界定？

DAO组织是以区块链技术应用结合管理学自组织管理理论产生的新型管理组织，由一群有着共同愿景的组织和个人自愿加入组织，协作完成组织目标和任务，并根据工作职责、工作量化、工作效果的实现，以通证激励方式来完成利益分配，对组织的管理、运营、决策等通过区块链技术的共识机制和智能合约来落实执行，从而实现智能化管理和通证激励的组织形态。

二、DAO在管理理论中处于何种位置？

管理理论的七个逻辑阶梯理论：早期管理、家长式管理、经验式管理、科学化管理、现代化管理、虚拟化管理和创新管理。作者认为：DAO组织管理则是创新管理的典型代表。

title: C r O w｜2/60 DAO本质探讨、法律性质界定
body:
### @crow_wetland

> **“去中心化自治组织”的法律性质探析，郭少飞（CNKI）**

### 【摘要】

去中心化自治组织乃区块链智能合约的集合，具备主体、财产(代币)、成员权、表决机制等组织要素。

去中心化自治组织设立时，投资者经由智能合约完成投资，取得投票、分红等权利，类似于众筹尤其股权众筹，但两种模式下**所涉主体关系、组织治理方式**存在本质差异。

### 【本质:区块链智能合约的集成】

去中心化自治组织：区块链智能合约的实体形态

本质上，去中心化自治组织是精密的智能合约或智能合约体系。「Henning Diedrich，Ethereum:Blockchains，Digital Asets，Smart Contracts，Decentralized Autonomous Organizations， South Carolina:Create Space Independent Publishing Platform，2016，p.31.」

> **案例：The DAO**

对于 The DAO，“去中心化”在于持有代币的所有投资者均可投票; “自治”在于项目提案以智 能合约形式存储于区块链上，且组织事务由 DAO 代码管理，无需中心化体系。

### 以The DAO为例，总结出DAO的结构要素

### 参与主体：

发起：Slock.it公司（公开源代码，作出安全保障）——发起主体在DAO成立初期选任“curator”

投资：DAO代码会分配代币，使投资者成为持有人(token holder)——投资者通过ETH可成为“contractor”，提交提案

Curator负责确认源自可辨识的个人或组织的资助提案，以及与提案相关的智能合约是否正确体现了Contractor要求布置于以太坊区块链上的代码，符合标准则放入whitelist，一旦得到多数代币持有人同意，提案将付诸实施

### 数字财产：

The DAO代币属于权益代币 (Equity Token)，类似于公司股份，表征代币持有人对 The Dao的表决、管理、分红等权益，功能：享有增长红利；权益证明

ETH属于应用代币(App Coin)，用于价值交换

### 权利关系：

发起者，拥有组织控制权；技术程式、运行规则的建构（确立组织商业模式、架构及与投资者关系）

投资者，享有提案权、投票权（权重基于其持有的代币量）、分红权及其他成员权

curator：保持对提出的、表决的和资助的提案的最终控制权（为防止curator滥权，投资者可投票更换curator，但易使组织陷入分裂）

### 表决机制：

提案的具体方式是:编写一个智能合约，并在以太坊区块链上公开应用

前提：拥有The DAO代币；支付ETH押金

### 【法律性质的反向界定】

**(一)去中心化自治组织并非众筹**

一，在主体方面，股权众筹存在融资平台，连接融资人与投资人;权益代币发行没有此类平台。

二，就项目选择，股权众筹先由融资人发布项目，经平台验证，投资人投资后 取得项目所属企业股权;权益代币发行，不直接对应特定项目，而是组织设立后，投资人提出项目并由全体投票决定。

三，从组织体看，股权众筹涉及的公司、合伙企业通常事先注册成立，投资人投 资后成为股东、合伙人;而权益代币发行，是去中心化自治组织创立进程。

四，在治理方面，股权 众筹为符合法律对成员人数限制，会特设一个代表广大投资者的组织作为项目所属企业成员;去中 心化自治组织无中心化组织机关，治理结构独特。

**(二)去中心化自治组织亦非商事信托**

一、去中心化自治组织对接收的财产拥有所有权，对外可自主开展经营活动，享有营业自由。而商事信托受托人权利限于取得报酬、优先受偿等，要小的多。

二、去中心化自治组织的投资者对项目可作出提案、表决，决定组织财产的用途及 流向，其法律地位更似组织成员，而非受托人。而商事信托下，信托财产名义上归受托人，委托人一般不得管理使用，也没有投票权 等共同事务管理权。

三、在责任财产方面，去中心化自治组织的代币若不能被认定为责任财产，不能强制执行，就无法对外承担法律责任。而受托人解散时信托财产不得作为责任财产，债权人通常不得追及，也不能强制执行。

四、以商事信托定性去中心化自治组织存在不确定性。Carla L.Reyes 也承认，并非所有的去中心化自治组织都以商事信托方式构建，未来的去中心化自治组织不受任何以这种方式构建的要求的约束。「Carla L.Reyes，“If Rockefeler Were a Coder”，Geo.Wash.L.Rev，Vol.87，2018.」

**(三)去中心化自治组织更非公司**

去中心化自治组织与公司存在重大区别。

一，组织机构。公司有一套完整的组织机 构，而去中心化自治组织没有此类中心化机构。

二，住所。公司须有住所。去中心化自治组织存 在于区块链之上，没有中心节点，没有中心服务器，难谓住所。

三，出资人数。公司设立之出资人 人数有限。去中心化自治组织创立时，没有人数限制。

四，法定性。现行法实行公司法定原则。 去中心化自治组织尚无实证法规范。

### 【去中心化自治组织：有限合伙】

去中心化自治组织具备商事合伙本体要素（在中国，合伙企业应具备合伙人、出资或合伙财产、合伙协议、合伙名称及住所）

**一、合伙人。**

从初始成员主体角度，去中心化自治组织包括两类合伙人，一是作为发起人的合伙人， 二是作为投资者的合伙人，组织地位、作用、权利不同。

表征成员地位的代币可在二级市场自由交易，由此合伙人可频繁变动，最终须以代币识别合伙人。

而监管人对组织享有重大权力，已然超越普通投资者，但通常不是合伙人，不享有分红权，且在终极意义上可被投资者改选，在法律地位上应确定为组织的管理者。

**二、合伙财产。**

代币可用于能为成员带来收益的具体项目或事务。在组织运营期间，所有以组织名义取得或累积的财产收益，均系合伙财产。

**三、合伙协议。**

去中心化自治组织基于区块链而生，当事人合伙协议认定不同于传统理论，可从三方面分析。

（1）发起人就去中心化自治组织作出的说明、宣传等资料，如 The DAO白皮书、网站说明等，可辅证协议内容。

（2）在智能合约领域，承诺源自履行。一个人说他们将成立一个智能合约，该合约在常规法律中可能是合同，但直到程序启动，智能合约尚不存在。一旦采取行动开始承诺，如把一定数量的货币交由代码控制，合同订立。「Max Raskin，“The Law and Legality of Smart Contracts”，Geo.L.Tech.Rev，Vol.1:2，2017，p.323.」

（3）投资者匿名且陌生化，无碍于合伙协议认定。即使主体匿名，基于当事人利用区块链智能合约，可推定当事人 具有与链上任一节点主体达成交易的概括意思，至少不逾越其可预见的交易对象范畴，相对人匿名不影响当事人意思表示的认定。

**四、合伙名称及住所。**

名称：去中心化自治组织有统一名称，便于指称、对外交往，符合合伙名称条件 。

住所：以太坊区块链是公链，完全分布式，无中心化端点，无中心服务器。The DAO住所难以确定。从存在状态看，它分布于全网，全球各地人们皆可经互联网与之联系。

title: C r O w｜1/60 DAO核心属性、理论解析与应用前景
body:
### @crow_wetland

> **基于区块链技术的去中心化自治组织核心属性、理论解析与应用前景，陈加友（CNKI）**

### 【摘要】

定义上的贡献：界定了区块链DAO的内涵与外延

区块链DAO的运行要件：智能合约、通证激励、分布式自治

理论上的贡献：与管理学理论发展路径的关系

案例：以“The DAO”为例分析了其发展状况与制约因素（制约因素：法律地位不明确、投票者参与度低、存在安全问题等）

【如何理解DAO】

“区块链在组织治理层面的（代表性）实践”

【DAO发展的背景条件】

1、基于区块链技术的智能合约

2、疫情催化人类向数字时代全面跃迁（全球性的线上分布式办公）

【DAO的组织特点】

打破了过去传统中心化组织的科层制度与封闭的组织形态，在一定程度上体现着对去中心化的诉求和更加灵活的微观决策机制

### 【相关研究综述】

> 理论构想

1. 2006 首次构建去中心化自治组织理论雏形：Ori Brafman et al. 将中心化组织与去中心化组织分别比喻成蜘蛛 与海星；*「奥瑞·布莱福曼，罗德·贝克斯特朗.海星模式:彻底颠覆集权式管理\[M\].北京:中信出版社，2008:1-5.」*
2. Yochai Benkler提出了类似的概念一同行生产（ Peer Production），描绘了一个没有阶级没有严格制度的组织机构，在这一组织中，并行生产的参与者拥有多样性的动机，独立分散地开展工作，通过相互间的交流来达到协调一致；*「BENKLLER Y. The wealth of networks: how social production transforms markets and freedom\[M\]. New Haven: Yale University Press, 2006: 29.」*
3. 在社会治理方面，动态网民群体组织(Cyber Movement Organizations，CMOs)出现， 为去中心化自治组织的构建和运行奠定基础；
4. 2013 Daniel Laimer 提出去中心化自组织公司 (Decentralized Autonomous Corporation, DAC)
5. 2014 Daniel Laimer创立Bitshares
6. Vitalik Buterin 通过描述一家公司 在没有经理人的情况下如何运作，进一步推进了 去中心化自治组织的理论构建
7. 2016 “The DAO”作为一个由程 序代码管理的自治的风险投资基金诞生，其目标是为商业组织和非营利企业提供一种新的分散式商业模式，至此去中心化自治组织真正实现了落地

> 对DAO的界定

1. 野口悠纪雄：将去中心化自治组织与传统组织 进行对比，指出去中心化自治组织根据协议中定义的规则进行决策与执行，从而摆脱了传统组织中的管理者
2. 丁文文等：是将组织不断迭代的管理和运作规则(共识)以 智能合约的形式逐步编码在区块链上，从而在没 有第三方干预的情况下，使得组织按照预先设定 的规则实现自运转、自治理、自演化，进而实现组 织的最大效能和价值流转的组织形态
3. 张礼卿、吴桐：随着区块链记账节点的增多和市场范围的扩大，区块链交易的边际成本会出现递减，在组织成本和交易成本曲线的交点上大量的市场组织会以去中心化自治组织的形式存在\*「张礼卿，吴桐.区块链在金融领域的应用:理 论依据、现实困境与破解策略\[J\].改革，2019 (12):65-75.」\*

### 【核心属性与运行要件】

### 核心属性

**去中心化**

区块链实现数据与价值的点对点传输：不需要经过中心化机构审核与控制

1、分布式系统抗攻击

2、在一定程度上打破了以科层制为主要组织形式的官僚制度，增强了微观决策机制的灵活性

💡 与传统公司自上而下的中心化结构、多层次的垂直管理和官僚主义的刚性协调机制不同，去中心化自治组织中的组织节点之间遵循的是平等、自愿、互惠的原则，从而摒弃了传统组织中较为刚性的官僚制度以及随之而来的道德法律风险

3、通证的激励作用也使得去中心化自治组织系统能够在没有第三方干预的情况下实现利益调整

**自治化**

* 传统组织的规则必须有相应的指导原则与相关的解释，在执行过程中易受到人为因素的影响；系统高层管理者的主观判断对系统影响较大，而且这一过程往往是**单向的，缺乏交互性**
* 在去中心化自治组织中，规则执行是由智 能合约自动完成的，一旦系统开始运行，原则上 就不需要人工管理；自治的交互性系统，有效降低了组织内部的**信任和沟通成本**

**扁平开放性**

传统的组织往往拥有一个相对统一的管理者或中心部门，通过严格的等级制度保障规则的执行，金字塔结构

* 去中心化自治组织：

去中心化自治组织项目本质上都是全球性项目

* 每个个体都可以发布提议并通过投票来作决策
* 制定一套标准规则，打破组织内外边界，让每个个体可以不用考虑地理位置参与工作
* 每个个体可以随时加入或离开组织，组织的运行不受个体的影响
* 组织治理的线上线下协调和链上链下协作

### 运行要件

智能合约

智能合约是一项通过将规则和法规纳入区 块链系统自动运行的技术，各参与主体的权利义务经由智能合约确定并执行

智能合约的特征是自我验证、自我执行、 防止篡改，将过去需要人为管理的契约执行过程 转变成由程序自动协调的流程，有效消除了中介方的参与降低了交易成本和执行成本

通证激励

吴桐等认为，通证包含了股权属性(可增值、具有长期收益)、物权属性(代表 使用权、商品或服务)和货币属性(在一定范围内 可流通)

对通证的 发行量、流通量、锁仓期、分配方式等相关要素进 行调整，从而完善激励和治理模式

去中心化自治组织在正式上线之后就 不再属于其创始人和开发者，而是由多个利益相 关者共同拥有，成为生态内的公共品，真正实现 了数字范式下的共享经济

通证激励 使得货币资本、人力资本、技术资本、数据资本 以及其他要素充分融合

分布式自治

在物 理空间上高度分散的各节点对组织治理和任务 完成达成共识，为解决传统科层制和金字塔 式管理架构中存在的逆向选择和道德风险问题 提供了解决方案

### 【理论解析】

**博弈论与共识算法**

共识机制 就是通过设计一个博弈机制来实现良性的竞争 激励机制:奖励遵守规矩的参与者，让破坏规则 者受到惩罚乃至出局

机制设计理论

Hurwicz L.创立的机制设计理论指出，参与市场经济活动的个体因利己性都会自觉或不自 觉地采取维护自身利益的行为，而不关注其他节点的利益效用函数

激励相容理论：机制设计的一种深化解决方案

基于区块链的去中 心化自治组织通过激励相容的算法规则和契约 安排，确保了各方的利益，在保证组织利益最大 化的同时，维护了众多参与者的个体利益

新制度经济学角度

**产权理论**

产权安排对集体中的个 人行为造成激励，直接影响着最终资源配置的结 果，清晰的产权能够保证经济运行的效率

智能合约在数字技术范式下重新界定 了产权，将人和组织之间的协议及网络间的复杂 关系程序化，利用协议和用户接口完成从协商到 履行的所有步骤

去中心化自治组织通过将创始 团队、技术人员、消费者等多种属性的节点通过 智能合约协调利益、紧密联系，明确各方的权利、 责任、利益，实现了事实意义上产权的明确性

链上通证的流通可以实现不同节点间产权的 转移

数字经济下的产权范 畴更加丰富，包含了股权、使用权、收益权、投票 权、参与权等多种权利

**交易成本理论**

“交易费用”这一概念最早由科斯提出，他将交易 费用分为交易前期寻找交易对象的费用、交易过 程中协商沟通和制定协议契约的费用、交易后期 监督契约落实结果的费用

区块链的分布式记账解决 了合同真伪及组织运转过程中的监督执行问题， 减少了信用成本;智能合约则减少了成员谈判 和签约的费用，减少了交易成本

**委托代理理论**

科层制造成的层级间信息鸿沟，以及不 同层级参与者利益目标冲突等，产生了大量的内 部代理成本

去中心化自治组 织打破了层级分明的科层制度，实现了各节点之 间的平等化和组织形态的扁平化，账本的公共化 则在一定程度上解决了信息不对称问题

智能合约自动和强制执行规则的属性为身处不 信任环境的参与者之间进行交易提供了解决方案，避免了传统委托代理理论的契约问题

### 【The DAO 应用案例】

“The DAO”作为一个将资金(目 前以以太坊平台通证以太币为主)分散到项目的 枢纽进行运作，参与者通过通证获得投票权，然 后对“承包商”提交的提案进行投票，生态内的志 愿者检查提交提案的人员的身份，确认无误后将 其列入白名单，投资产生的收益将基于智能合约 流回利益相关者

“The DAO”的通证不一定 通过投资获得，也可以通过对生态有正向外部性 的行为获得，通证持有者具有对生态发展决策进 行投票的权力

保证 了通证持有者将选票投给真正对生态具有正向 外部性的决策，充分调动了各节点的积极性

**制约因素**

1、法律

去中心化自治组织不存在注册的 商业实体，而这些个人和机构可 能生活在不同的司法辖区；

去中心化自治组织不产生负债，也不像 公司一样要面临着负债约束，通过债权工具发挥 作用的治理机制难以实现；

在公有链中，所有协 议都采用开源代码的形式，由所有参与者的多数 一致意见自行执行，而不是采取现实意义的法律 条文；一旦去中心化自治组织被部署，就独立于其 创建者，不能被一个单独的实体审查，而是由组 织中预先定义的大多数参与者审查，这与现有的 法律条款很可能产生抵触；

2、政治参与

通证持有者投票参与度较低

大部分基于 POS 的区块链记账节点往 往会选择放弃投票权，而选择抵押通证并获得固 定收益，这也就是所谓的“Staking Economy”

两个问题：一是投票只反映少部分通证持有 量大的节点的意志，无法体现大多数中小节点的 意志。这与股票市场上广大的中小股东不太关心 公司决策与运营，而对二级市场的股票价格波动 非常关心类似。二是在记账权集中在少数节点的 情况下，黑客发起系统攻击需要的成本并不高

3、安全

无法在缺乏共识的情况下进行 代码更改，而达成共识需要一定的时间，有可能错过黄金debug时间；智能合约往往直接 担负资金分配责任，一旦出现漏洞会直接导致巨 大的经济损失

title: Unfolding Knowledge
body:
***Is knowledge the truth? 
 What assurance do you have? 
 If not for guessing.***

Everything mentioned in this essay is true. Not to you but to me. Truthfully, this is my best guess at explaining how knowledge evolves. As a reader, you will comprehend these words according to what’s true to you. When you read something false, you’ll test that idea until it’s proven wrong or right. This mismatch of opinions unfold what’s true, rather than me having to justify it:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/KA_SZ0uub_ctNOQmhJKt8.png?height=505&width=394)

Surely, this essay has entertained you so far. It will continue to do so as we unfold into the following:

* Evolving From Experiments
* Sticking To The Status Quo
* Decentralized Knowledge
* Guesses For The Future

## Evolving From Experiments

Knowledge is a variation of guesses, made true or false by criticism and experiments.

The internet — a collection of open-sourced protocols — has become the foundation for the knowledge we’ve built. It took decades of experiments to get here. When does it stop? Never. Experiments are necessary for knowledge to be criticized, errors corrected, and solutions selected. Unfolding new knowledge becomes a flywheel for new experiments:

> “Six decades into the computer revolution, four decades since the invention of the microprocessor, and two decades into the rise of the modern Internet, all of the technology required to transform industries through software finally works and can be widely delivered at global scale.”—[Marc Andreessen](https://a16z.com/2011/08/20/why-software-is-eating-the-world/)

Justified knowledge happens when existing ideas aren’t criticized enough to be disproved. This slows down experiments from happening, new solutions from unfolding, and better options to be pursued. Societies fail because of their inability to correct problems when realized. If civilizations can’t fix fragile ideas quick enough, catastrophes would eventually cause them to fail.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5W26G9lvtZyntDRIocIML.png?height=641&width=1200)

### Rome Could Be Destroyed In A Day

The Roman Empire was a powerful civilization that had problems with corruption. Law administrators were appointed and elected by citizens to create and pass legislation. However, as the state’s circumstances went through changes, its constitution changed very little. What did change were the laws that restricted actions of Roman citizens. This gradually made the state’s people more corrupt to find ways around such restrictions. Flaws of Rome’s corrupt system came from appointing administrators who ran for power, not virtue:

> “For then it was not the most virtuous but the most powerful who stood for election, and the weak, even if virtuous, were too frightened to run for office.”––[Machiavelli](https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=Machiavelli:+Selected+Political+Writings&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8)

After they conquered countries in Africa and Asia, the Roman empire believed that they’d never fall. Each passing day gave more confidence to that statement. This sense of security made people elect leaders based on popularity rather than competence. As a result, their central political experiment failed. This could’ve been prevented had the constitution been criticized enough to seek out new solutions.

Yes reader, I hope you’re not the jolly fellow who fails to see the need for experiments. By criticizing knowledge, we find flaws in it. Experiments find fixes to such flaws, which bring in new ideas. We need variations of such guesses and experiments for knowledge to evolve. As you read my words and contradict or question them, understand the profoundness regardless of it being true or not:

> "The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth"—[Bohr](https://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en&q=Niels+Bohr&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8)

## Sticking To The Status Quo

Authorities who justify existing ideas often resemble popular high-schoolers banging on tables and singing:

***“No. No. No. 
 Stick to the stuff you know, 
 If you wanna be cool follow one simple rule, 
 Don’t mess with the flow, no-no. 
 Stick to the status quo!”***

Justified knowledge is the product of knowledge not criticized enough to understand its limitations. It has the power to shut down experiments to prevent further change from happening. Suppressing criticism protects the status quo from change. This blurs the lines between what’s fair and unfair.

### The Status Quo On Finance

Of roughly 750 currencies that have existed since 1700, only about 20% remain, and all of them have devalued. The dollar, along with other state-held currencies today face similar [problems](https://wtfhappenedin1971.com/). Meanwhile, people who use such currencies have no choice but to trust the state’s valuation in them.

Experiments and authorities don’t mix because the search for truth becomes a search for endorsement. The U.S. dollar became the world reserve currency as it pegged itself to gold. In [1971](https://wtfhappenedin1971.com/), excessive spending by the federal reserve made the dollar claims on gold more than the actual amount of gold available. Through America's authority, the dollar’s link to gold broke away. This decision gave birth to “fiat currency”, meaning “formal authorization”:

> “We have developed these practices and institutions by building upon habits and institutions which have proved successful in their own sphere and which have in turn become the foundation of the civilization we have built up.” —[Friedrich Hayek](https://www.econlib.org/library/Essays/hykKnw.html)

Fiat became the standard for monetary knowledge today. It’s based on people trusting the money supply on the state’s promise to not inflate it. This solution is sustainable as long as inflation is under control, which hasn’t been too promising. For years, the federal reserve have authorized monetary policy while claiming power to regulate financial experiments. Central banking structures will continue to justify the status quo on finance until suitable knowledge comes along to change it:

> “The U.S. set the rules of the game through their control of the international financial institutions – the International Monetary Fund (IMF) for short-term lending to sovereigns and the World Bank for long-term development finance. The U.S. maintained an open capital account and allowed their securities markets to become a global piggy bank for savers worldwide…We need foreigners to buy our debt, so the government can finance its structurally high levels of spending. But we increasingly seek to impose moral conditions on who can hold that debt.”––[America’s Quiet Default](https://www.coindesk.com/layer2/2022/03/09/americas-quiet-default/)

For all we know, government intervention––like printing dollars from thin air––may eventually suffocate the fish:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9vs-6I2tfqeBgWUhB-wQZ.png?height=734&width=550)

Don’t get mad dear reader, this does not invalidate you by saying authority is bad and there must be defiance to evolve. I mean to demonstrate that knowledge justified by authority––rather than supporting evidence––should not be considered the furthest truth we have. While authority may stop competition to gain power, criticism of ideas are necessary. We must experiment to test true limits of the status quo, even if it means failure.

## Decentralized Knowledge

Decentralization happens when no single owner can alter the rules of its network.

Traditional computing lets companies own the distribution of online content within their platform. They own the hardware, which lets them control the software within it. Yes reader, I understand these companies make it easy for people to publish content online to be shared with others. I mean to remind you that for-profit companies have incentives that are different from their users.

The popularity of TikTok involves making it easy for people to remix anyone's content on the app. It's dead simple to grab any element from a TikTok and create something new with it. The problem is that such content is centrally controlled by its platform. Those who own the hardware control the rules of its software. Does TikTok let you convert your following to YouTube subscribers? That’s against TikTok’s status quo. This resembles power central banks have with monetary policy. Whether it’s data or money, central owners can impose certain restrictions to the actions of its users:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/L1FZ3fFFPhfDnbuW7Lw60.png?height=635&width=562)

Fundamentally, blockchains are a solution to an old [computer science problem](https://river.com/learn/what-is-the-byzantine-generals-problem/) that gives people knowledge to run a censorship-resistant system. A decentralized system fixes traditional computing by letting software run autonomously from owners of its hardware. It creates a digital space without authority to justify status quo:

> “Anyway, from this vantage point, many of the ideas on how to organize human society have been around forever, but technologies make them feasible and infeasible by turns. A political ideology that requires total centralized control may seem unstoppable when technology favors this…and then may become untenable when innovation turns things in the direction of decentralization. ”––[Balaji Srinivasan](https://sotonye.substack.com/p/if-einstein-had-the-internet-an-interview?s=r)

Bitcoin is the first blockchain experiment as a response to the economic interventions of central banks. Architecturally, blockchains let computers make logical agreements that a system will operate as designed, without intervention. There’s no owner to impose power over the network. The scarcity of bitcoin without central control creates the software equivalent to a periodic element.

Surely you’re thinking bitcoin has failed in its approach as a digital currency. You’re not wrong but it's an experiment worth demonstrating nonetheless. Given that there is no alternative to providing digital value transfer without central authority, it is by definition an efficient solution. Whether decentralized experiments are adopted or not is determined by direct feedback from free markets. Though it may not be suitable to adopt, watching it unfold is worth betting on.

## Guesses For The Future

> “All of the information accessible on the internet is estimated at 40 trillion gigabytes, which is roughly enough to hold a high-def video lasting the entire 14 billion years since the big bang.”––[Morgan Housel](https://www.collaborativefund.com/blog/think/)

The internet evolved from a decentralized experiment that let computers communicate with each other. This eventually evolved to let people communicate ideas through computers. From a collection of network protocols, we found a microphone to share our memes:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3jsxJrP74GioTR0gSYl0Q.png?height=2048&width=434)

The most important essay on finance this decade, “[Why Software Is Eating The World](https://a16z.com/2011/08/20/why-software-is-eating-the-world/)” has partially come true. Software gains competitive advantage around the world because of how the internet scales distribution. What is important to note, is that there are strong winner-take-all effects that can happen. The monopoly of data exchanged by people on such platforms can be used against them through targeted media, misinformation, and censorship.

I believe that we're in the middle of a dramatic experiment in which decentralized organizations are poised to contribute a large part to solving such problems. Take it from a self-proclaimed professional cloud developer. We are entering a golden-age of computing that offers knowledge of decentralized digital ownership. The experiments on blockchains are improved extensions of what the internet first started out as:

> “I don’t think we’ve even seen the tip of the iceberg…I think the potential of what the internet is going to do to society, both good and bad, is unimaginable. I think we’re actually on the cusp of something exhilarating and terrifying.” —[David Bowie](https://twitter.com/CaliPnL/status/1449195966720929794?s=20&t=6wfi8eobG1PM8VqwmBWPMA)

Ah reader, you’ve read far enough. Nice. This has been a summary of my knowledge on––well––knowledge, experiments, authority, and decentralization. There are still many ideas on decentralization being tested. Until it scales for people to truly adopt, markets will continue to prove its infancy. That’s not to say the ideas aren’t worth betting on:

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-H4ld43tUrHV6IzD83HVX.png?height=1392&width=1072)

Future essays will come after I’ve invested more time and energy to experiments on the third era of the internet. Until then, this will remain to be my first experiment. Let it be accountable to your criticisms for us to unfold what’s true.

***You have read this far, 
 Please understand conjecture, 
 For it may be true.***

\-rushil

title: C r O w｜Solv Protocol的Voucher通证：金融NFT的探索
body:
（作者注：本文原标题为Solv Protocol的通证范式：以Voucher实现DeFi与NFT的双向建构，首发于Crow_寒鸦的个人公众号；本文图片来源于solv官网与google image）

Crow（ZITENG ZHANG）

**摘要**
Solv Protocol是将NFT应用于金融的一项DeFi协议。藉由versatile NFT（vNFT）这一独创性的通证标准，Solv为DeFi现存的市场诉求提供了金融NFT（Financial NFT）的解决方案，同时也重新诠释了NFT的价值意涵。Voucher是基于Solv的金融NFT，可被视为一种加密资产的“容器”。在本文语境中，Voucher是Solv所建立的vNFT通证范式的表达载体，也是实现DeFi与NFT双向建构的介质工具。随着加密市场对Solv Voucher更广泛地应用，Solv的通证范式有助于推动社会意义上的市场整合。

**一、Solv Protocol的基本信息及其结构**
**项目基本情况**
根据crunchbase上列示的信息，Solv Protocol由Mike Meng, Ryan Chow, Will Wang于2020年10月成立，总部位于新加坡。Solv目前已完成两轮融资：在2021年5月10日完成100万美元的种子轮融资；在2021年11月30日完成400万美元的A轮融资，得到Blockchain Capital、IOSG Ventures等22家投资机构支持（cypherhunter）。Solv目前已与DODO DEX、CryptoArt.ai、YINFinance等多个项目达成合作以扩展其生态。

**Solv Protocol概述**
Solv Protocol在官方项目文件Solv  Documentation中被界定为“创建、管理、交易金融NFT的去中心化平台”。其中，“金融NFT”这一概念指的是代表、证明金融权益的NFT，也可以理解为以NFT为表达形式的金融工具。
金融NFT相较于其他NFT的鲜明特征是其量化属性，本质是一种被Solv团队称为“可计算NFT”的NFT子类。
Solv 团队自2020 年 10 月开始研究可计算 NFT，对其概念、意义和核心思想进行了明确的界定与阐释，据此建立了一种新的加密数字资产标准EIP-3525——“versatile NFT”，其定位是“可计算NFT标准”，vNFT本质上是一种支持数量描述的NFT。基于此标准在Solv上铸造的NFT被称为Voucher（凭证、凭单），voucher可以被灵活地拆分与合并，进行线性运算，从而适用于复杂的、定制化的金融需求。
Voucher的创建、管理与交易通过Solv Markerplace实现，后者是Solv的去中心化交易所。Solv Protocol的所有交易在以太坊等公链上执行，但Solv Marketplace也保留了中心化机制的NFT交易所的一些售卖方案。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/E9qxvSwsH-ol4AVtK32jq.png?height=900&width=1600)

**Solv时间线**
Solv自第一个Solv投资凭证在2021年3月22日发布以来，于 6 月 17日在以太坊主网正式启动，6月29日发起Seahorse Initiative海马计划（8月9日在BSC正式发布）；7月20日上线了marketplace v2.1；8月24日通过慢雾的智能合约安全审计；9月29日发起Solv KOL Club；在12月13日正式推出 Solv 的 IVO（初始凭证发行），在币安NFT与Solv v2.5 platform上线了代表$Solv 分配的Vesting Voucher（归属凭证）。

**Solv Protocol**
Solv项目的整体框架如表1所示。需要补充的是：除却自有的交易平台，在币安NFT、OpenSea等NFT市场也能实现Voucher的交易；海马计划旨在吸引项目在其二级市场平台上以 Solv“凭证”的形式发行和管理其分配，目前已有DODO、Parsiq、Bounce、NAOS Finance、Prometeus、Bella、Ankr、Saffron Finance、Impossible Finance、Taker Protocol、XCarnival等项目加入。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/HZYViuS7mjcWMJo6pwvat.png?height=432&width=936)

**二、在Solv Voucher之前**
在具体展开Voucher及其背后的vNFT通证标准所具有的双向建构性特征之前，对Solv所处的行业背景予以考察是必要的，这有助于我们理解Solv何以被称为是FNaaS（Financial NFT as a Service）——作为一项服务，Solv在眼下的DeFi与NFT领域解决的是什么问题。
**	DeFi的精细化与灵活性诉求**
DeFi发展至今，从基础设施、去中心化借贷、DEX、稳定币到资管、衍生品类项目与聚合器，在智能合约的技术条件下基本实现了对CeFi传统业务的全面复刻，且相较于传统金融还催生出诸多金融创新。但正如CeFi历史上所呈现的发展趋势——市场需求趋于细分、金融工具趋于多元，DeFi也在经历金融服务的定制化与精细化过程。如果说上一阶段的DeFi主要以市场广度为导向，则未来DeFi将在深度上有更多上行的空间。
而回到金融交易的媒介——货币层面，同质化代币是DeFi高效率运转、无差别地兑换流通的基础，但也在某种程度上限制了DeFi更细化、更复杂的金融实践——尤其是在智能合约的代码治理环境中。如果同质化代币要应对多元化的需求，则对于每一需求都需要发行代币，在理论上是可行的，但是在实际操作中显然成本高昂，并非是市场最优解。
DeFi的代币基础所缺乏的“自描述能力”与根据需求定制token产品的属性，加密市场是通过同质化的反面：非同质化，具体而言是基于ERC-721的NFT来实现的，但NFT也需要面临自身的短板：流动性低，且难以量化进行计算。
**	NFT的可量化与流动性诉求**
首先，NFT的唯一标识性很好地适用于数字艺术与收藏品等加密资产，但应用于金融产品时则无法拆分合并，进行量化处理。在逻辑上每一个NFT的叙事都是单称命题，理论上不存在全称或特称命题，因为相较于DeFi“所有的代币都是同一个代币”，NFT代币只能反映其自身，过分强调内部的异质性导致NFT的原子化弊端。
其次，由于NFT彼此异质，对NFT价值的衡量缺乏可靠统一的标准，在这样的语境中，往往是非正式的社会性因素带来某一NFT的高估值（例如NBA TopShot中编号与明星球衣编号一致的Moment会售得高价），且NFT具有更强的社区划分能力，除却NFT投机行为，NFT在不同题材的受众群体之间流通较为困难，因为它无法像同质化代币那样被广泛认可，造成NFT“有价无市”。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IMpGPIPmZsZOWC42tyWVK.png?height=1376&width=2104)

**DeFi的“NFT-ization”与NFT的“Financialization”**
在DeFi领域，前沿的创新来自Uniswap V3 LP token的NFT化实践，Non-Fungible Liquidity Pools — Why NFT-ization Is The Only Path For DeFi一文对Uniswap“非同质化的流动性池”作了详细的阐述，这一跨越式创新通过价格范围的自主定义实现了每一个LP与每一笔头寸在流动性池中的映射关系。DeFi现有的NFT化尝试还有Armor与88mph。但Uniswap V3的LP也因此陷入了ERC-721的固有困境：流动性显著降低。DeFi综述一文指出：Uniswap所提出的通过外围协议来解决的方案，“是比较僵硬且代价高昂的，因为 ERC721 不支持拆分或者部分转让，从而无法让做市商像以往那样灵活处理手中的 LP 资产，同时新增一层外围协议也会让 GAS 消耗增加和信任度降低。”
在NFT领域，为流动性与拆分性所作的努力主要呈现为“金融化”过程。NFT可被用于抵押借贷，例如Aave 正在试验将 NFT 作为抵押品、DROPS允许通过质押NFT获得其底价80%的贷款；“碎片化”也是该过程的另一表征：例如Fractional.art在以太坊上搭建了碎片化协议，通过将NFT锁进智能合约发行ERC-20来降低持有单件NFT的门槛，但正如Morty在金融化会是NFT下一个扩张方向吗？一文中所指出的：“大部分的碎片化代币无法保持刚发行时的高交易量及TVL”，背后的逻辑或许是非同质化的稀缺性与社交符号意义由于多地址持有而被稀释，后者削弱了代币与意义系统的连接。
综上所述，DeFi与NFT发展至今，由于自身代币标准的不足而选择向对方靠拢，但在补足短板时又因为结构性的因素，通常难以摆脱对方所陷入的困境，两者优势兼得则需要花费额外的成本。

**三、通证标准的矛盾本质上是由于抽象类型的不完备**
DeFi与NFT当下面临的问题或可归结为是底层代币标准的矛盾，但这一矛盾本质上是由于抽象类型的不完备。
ERC-20与ERC-721确实可以描述加密资产，但这样的二分法略显粗放。如果加密领域的运作要更接近社会的真实面貌，根据ERC-20与ERC-721两个标准来理解加密资产是有效的，却也是失真的。
因此Enjin团队提出ERC-1155标准，引入捆绑数量与“Token打包/解包”概念。ERC-1155相对于ERC-20与ERC-721是一种新的标准，也是一种新的结构与范型，以作为对现存标准的补充。这样的创新方向是值得肯定的，但ERC-1155的内部生态封闭，这种向后兼容性在可计算 NFT：概念、意义和核心思想一文中得到了很充分的表述。
与ERC-1155相比，Solv的vNFT同样是新的通证范式与标准的提出者，但实现路径却与ERC-1155不同。如果说ERC-1155的接近方式是自下而上再重新建立一套基础设施来支撑ERC-1155，那么vNFT更倾向于自上而下的共识改造——以抽象类型为切入点，通过NFT认识论层面的调整找到技术改进的着力点——同样在上述一文中，Solv的创始团队提出vNFT的核心创新在于“SLOT”这一抽象分类机制。
“SLOT 是一种抽象分类机制，它允许我们刻意地忽略事物的某些方面，而仅仅根据一些共性，就将不同的东西划归同一类。”但其实严格来说，这一机制并非简单的“分类”，因为“分类”需要力求“互斥性”等科学规范，而token之间往往存在多维度的共性。
若我们引述马克斯·韦伯“理想类型”的概念定义——“通过片面强调一个或几个观点，通过综合许多散乱的、不连贯的、时有时无的具体的个别现象（这些现象由片面强调的观点归纳为统一的分析结构），就可以得到一个理想类型”，就可以发现SLOT机制更接近于此——肇始于韦伯的类型学方法。通过片面强调token的某一方面，我们采用SLOT机制的目的在于归纳为一个统一的分析结构，从而在技术上根据我们的需要将non-fungible变得fungible。在此核心思想下，Voucher被创设出来，且由于vNFT兼容ERC-721的环境，Voucher作为一种通证范式与价值流通的介质，将更有可能走出一条中间道路，为DeFi与NFT的双向建构提供有效的金融工具。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rt2npBrygDkU9cnhENO1d.png?height=976&width=2256)

**四、Voucher的建构性特征**
Voucher（或vNFT标准）的意义与价值不在于消弭DeFi与NFT之间的通证标准差异，也不在于为市场提供ERC-1155那种自成一体的系统。
Voucher对NFT的价值在于：vNFT的DeFi属性在NFT的原有结构（NFT+Art、NFT+Collectibles、NFT+Game）上建立一种新的金融应用场景，也部分解决了流动性问题。
Voucher对DeFi的价值在于：voucher本身作为NFT，在DeFi的原有结构（ERC-20 token）上建立一种新的金融基元/金融原语（financial primitives），成为由通证驱动的DeFi市场中新的组件模块。
Solv的投资机构之一，Apollo Capital的分析师David Angliss表示：“It is unlike anything we have really seen in the market so far, combining NFTs and DeFi.”基于项目团队的原创文章与市场其他公开信息，下述两张表格分别列示了将NFT与DeFi结合的voucher在两个领域表现出的特殊性。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/8SpiKnzyaDI8B7WXVBXlc.png?height=518&width=936)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/7V34Qrotr-Jwu7ErfSaZG.png?height=564&width=936)

Vesting Voucher（归属凭证）是Voucher的典型应用实践。 归属凭证是项目代币空投或流动性挖矿的理想选择，因为它们分配锁仓权益的成本更低。项目方通常可以选择以Vesting Voucher的形式将锁仓份额授予其早期投资人或团队成员。与之相关的Solv IC Market 是 Solv Protocol 的首发应用，其目的是基于 vNFT 标准表达一级市场投资的合约关系，降低项目方与投资人之间签订合约的执行成本与信任成本，促进项目锁仓份额在市场上的流通（IOSG）。例如，归属凭证的持有者可以在开放的 NFT 市场上进行交易，或通过 Vesting Vouchers 进行借贷，还可以将一组凭证打包并进行细分来发行衍生品。 在撰写本文时，Voucher的TVL为$ 46.75M，在Solv上铸造的Vouchers已达到4908个。TVL的前五位合作项目是YIN、CLS、vHIGH、（SOLV）、BINO、BEL，锁仓价值达到一百万美元以上。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2FmUPuEcVzl6IfTP0koAC.png?height=430&width=1156)

**五、Voucher与vNFT的市场整合**
Voucher与vNFT更广泛的意义在于，这一新兴的通证范式（结构）有助于重塑嵌入在金融行为中的社会关系，在价值取向上鼓励长期主义。
经济社会学家Baker.W在《国家证券市场的研究》一文中指出：市场不仅仅是一种价格机制，而更是一种社会整合机制。因此Baker沿用怀特等人的市场网络分析方法，将国家证券市场视为一种社会结构，分析其中的网络构成。
同样地，Solv的去中心化交易市场也可被视为一种社会整合机制，且作用于两大网络：项目方-投资方的信任网络、项目方-用户方的社区网络。Voucher通过操作性强的锁仓释放设定实现了对这两大网络的市场整合。
首先，在一级市场，若项目未采用lock-up staking，而仅以自由流动的ERC-20 token作为权益分配手段，则不利于项目早期的稳定运营发展；而在锁仓的语境下，长期坚定的投资者认可并愿意接受较长的锁仓期，但对于短期需要流动性的投资者而言，提前解锁将遭受损失，而此前的投资权益又无法及时地转化为流动性。通过Voucher，在需要时投资份额以vNFT的形式流通，这给投资者提供了稳定的心理预期，且智能合约的代码执行又提供了技术信任，因此项目方与投资者间能形成更稳固的信任关系，而无需为资产流动性作出妥协。
其次，Voucher为更紧密的早期用户网络与更长久的社区建设提供了有效的结构，或者说从制度设计上规避了原先的问题。社区网络通过更平权、更充分的参与机会得到加强，例如IVO就是这一市场网络整合的实例。但在实际应用中，技术资源与资金体量上的差异仍会造成加密市场的马太效应，IVO过程如何避免“科学家”以非正当的竞争手段获取更多的权益仍是绕不开的问题（例如Solv IVO需要KYC验证），对加密市场上已有的公平方案的借鉴或有助于社区网络内部的均质化与平等性。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/l5pWPjLqc4TuLnQcctjJq.png?height=452&width=1580)

**六、结论**
Solv Protocol提出了一种新的通证范式，通过Voucher实现了对DeFi与NFT的双向建构。在此不妨引入技术机会(technological opportunity)概念来评价solv在整个加密市场的地位：Solv提供的技术机会是一种机会类型，这一机会来自“技术环境衍生的制度安排实现特定活动的可能性”。随着vNFT标准取得更广泛的市场共识，Solv将搭建起更有机的生态系统；以Voucher为介质，与DeFi与NFT市场的其他项目更广泛的合作，也将为解决Solv自身面临的诸多挑战提供更多的可能性。

title: C r O w｜Proof of Humanity：去中心化身份认证系统与“主体唯一性”
body:
### Proof of Humanity：去中心化身份认证系统与“主体唯一性”

* Crow（ZITENG ZHANG）

Proof of Humanity（PoH）是以太坊区块链上进行“人类证明”的身份认证系统。PoH由Cooperative Kleros与Democracy Earth Foundation合作开发，将信任网、反向图灵测试等用于区分“人与机器”的经典方法结合起来，创建“人”的女巫证明列表。

PoH的技术原理支持通证的有效发放，无需中心化验证工具来确保“某个通证（例如UBI）每个接收者只能收到一次”，相当于解决经典的双花问题；PoH还支持去中心化民主，同样也无需中心化验证工具来确保“是否是真人在投票且只投一次”，目的是防止治理投票上的“女巫攻击”，相当于解决的是“双重人类”（“多重人类”）身份问题。

PoH的“非机器人测试”目前有诸多用例，在DAO治理中存在很多应用场景。本文主要从DAO治理工具的角度来考察PoH的设计机制，但在此之外，还试图进一步探究PoH的社会意涵：“身份”作为社会学的经典概念之一，在web3语境中发生了何种变化？PoH作为对“人”的证明机制，是否能引向更深刻的主体性反思？

![Figure 1 Proof of Humanity](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/nJSnntsQcsYwPMZMWCsla.png?height=262&width=818)

**一、PoH的提出背景**

在Proof of Humanity之前，我们所熟知的共识机制主要有PoW与PoS，分别表示“工作量证明”与“权益证明”。共识机制的作用在于维护系统的公平与有效运转，抵御试图破坏分布式系统的攻击——其中较为典型的就是“女巫攻击”。 “女巫攻击” 指的是通过创建许多非法的虚拟身份角色，使用它们来获得不成比例的影响、改变路由或修改冗余存储的内容来污染分布式系统。

PoW的女巫保护机制被描述为“一个CPU一票”系统（Nakamoto 2009），在此机制下，治理围绕算力属性展开，这对于传统以人治为中心的治理模式而言是颠覆性的，但它忽略了社会性：PoW对合法成员资格的认定，依靠的是算力消耗的社会资源成本与挖矿硬件设施的所有权门槛。

PoS被作为PoW的一种替代方案被提出。但针对PoS的批评则在于：加密货币的财阀掌握了治理的话语权。PoS对合法成员资格的认定，依靠的是特定的加密货币的所有权门槛，这一门槛相比于PoW有所降低，但它离民主、平权的共同理想还有距离：PoS所导致的系统中投票权的不平等，本质上是由于社会和金融市场中财富的帕累托分布（幂律分布）（Klass et al，2006年；Benhabib、Bisin和Zhu ，2014）。

不可否认的是，上述两种主流的共识机制已深刻改变了诸多领域的面貌，例如在金融领域支撑起DeFi生态的兴盛。但是，倘若我们希望区块链网络从金融应用扩散到社会、政治应用，PoW与PoS都难以单独回应这样的诉求——在公民参与的领域，通过“一个CPU一票”与“一个币一票”不可能达到真正的民主，而要实现“一人一票”，就需要用于验证人类独特身份的去中心化协议。

在去中心化技术范式出现之前，对于人类身份验证都依赖“中心化”手段：“PoH”的传统形式有血液，食物印，手印，证人签名，证明书及完成文件等，由国家授予并确认，例如身份证是国家统一为社会主体发布的超越具体社会身份的政治身份。但一方面，Desai曾指出：官方认可的身份证形式对全球约11亿人来说存在问题（Vyjayanti Desai 2017），另一方面，身份数据的存储依赖中心化结构，例如民族国家的政府机关或其他第三方平台。

![Figure 2  Decentralized identity systems shift the risk of data loss away from large central stores. Any single security breach will yield a much smaller haul of PII, thus changing the economics of a break-in attempt. Source: Gartner, 2017](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/AGnQeqZQrRKFgTvx251Sb.png?height=408&width=936)

Divya Siddarth等指出：“如果像马克斯·韦伯曾经定义的那样，‘国家垄断暴力’，那么监视国家（或监视资本）就是对身份的垄断。”现行的统一凭证机制积累了丰富的私人信息，却也形成了凭证垄断——与其说只有“我”能够证明“我是我”，不如说是只有国家、政府能证明“我是我”。

在区块链底层逻辑深刻改变社会生活的当下，算法与数学权威正在消解现代民族国家与中心化大机构的公信权威，个人信息的所有权正在通过加密技术回归个体本身。以此为背景，以PoH为代表的人类证明系统将更好地保障隐私权和参与权。

**二、PoH的实现路径**

PoH的技术基础是一种基于以太坊去中心化分散式的争议解决协议——Kleros，Kleros在分布式法庭上进行TCR（Token Curated Registry）实验，随后便提出了PoH这一基于TCRs和信任网的身份识别解决方案。

PoH的具体申请流程如下图（Figure 1）所示。简而言之，它需要审核用户的个人资料（人脸照片、包含语音信息的自拍视频等）来防止身份冒用，所用到的用户照片、bios和视频记录将在IPFS中存储。

![Figure 3 PoH updated flow chart](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/e6FMrENbVy5A9zBjyEhsE.png?height=556&width=936)

在上述证明材料外，它还需要有其他人来为新用户担保。如果一个成员为后来被去中心化分布式法院判定成“为重复或虚假的用户提供担保”，则会被从注册表中删除，失去其担保保证金。

为更好地说明PoH的技术逻辑，本文引用《Who Watches the Watchmen? A Review of Subjective Approaches for Sybil-resistance in Proof of Personhood Protocols》一文中列示的表格（Table 1），对现有的各类人格证明协议在技术实现路径上的区别进行比较。

![Table 1 Approach Characteristics and Comparisons](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/obzH8h-Jd014Zd5NQ10xL.png?height=608&width=936)

在这里我们可以看到，不同方案所需要的“基质”（substrate）是不一样的，从社交媒体信息到“身份控制的权益证明”，再到“现有的社会联系与每周网上聚会”等，这反映了“人类证明”的社会建构性。

与Kleros同样使用信任网的方案还有HumanityDAO、BrightID、Duniter，我们可以回到信任网与交叉验证的社会学基础对此加以探讨。

作为古典社会学的奠基人之一，齐美尔（Georg Simme）总结出身份的三个方面：社会性、交叉性、冗余性（Schützeichel 2013）。社会性指的是：身份是共享的；交叉性意味着没有人或群体可以作为身份验证的中心“瓶颈”；冗余性则表明：个体的独特性被无数独特的群体或信任来源的交集所过度决定。

上述理论指导了“交叉身份验证”框架的出现，而后者则成为支撑人格证明的重要基石：交叉身份验证建立在传统的信任网络计划的基础上，扩大了可考虑的标记的范围，如姓名、年龄、地址、GPS历史、互动、技能、工作、教育等，有了数据体系结构来记录交叉标记，可以通过跟踪唯一识别个体的几个特征来建立抗双花/Sybil的身份，同时将敏感信息保密（Immorlica、Jackson和Weyl 2019）。

回到PoH本身，“担保人”的设计，实质上提供了一个可信任和可追溯的社会网络，它与声誉、信用紧密关联。同时，在身份交叉性的理念下，PoH允许每个访问者将PoH上列示的某个人类身份，分享在自己的Reddit、Telegram、Twitter，通过接入更多元、规模更大的社交媒体网络，PoH的可靠性得到进一步保证。

**三、PoH的应用场景**

（1）DeFi身份验证

DeFi项目RCN在2021年宣布引入PoH，将去中心化身份带入信贷市场，RCN借贷双方的用户资料连接上PoH的注册表。通过PoH，DeFi市场的用户在平台内部即可验证另一个用户的身份。去中心化金融信贷市场连接上去中心化的身份信任网络，对DeFi生态而言是一次新的尝试：Santiago Siri将PoH称作“social layer on Ethereum”，PoH的“Profile”让基于信任的Undercollateralized Loans成为可能，借贷双方可以决定是否将抵押率从200%降至150%，乃至100%。

（2）NFT的抗女巫空投与分发

在NFT空投和分发的实践中，PoH能帮助项目方按照真人数量来发放NFT，来尽量规避NFT被囤积在少数人手里。

（3）基于Sybil抗性的DAO工具

PoH注册表检查投票者是否为真人，将推动DAO真实民主的发展。自主主权身份是流动式民主的关键，一旦crypto的“公民”（不限于DAO的社区成员）可以通过PoH的加密技术的认证系统来证明身份，我们就有可能在此基础上对链上民主进行更进一步的实践探索。

（4）身份之外的认证

PoH的认证系统还可以用于个体的其他权益或属性，例如认证公民权、认证学位与专业、认证技能（对开发人员的技能认证，可诉诸对其开源代码的评估）。PoH经过认证的信息可以在个人资料上公开显示为徽章。

（5）UBI通证系统

PoH具有高度实验性，Democracy Earth 和Kleros 发起了定期支付加密货币的大规模实验：Universal Basic Income（普遍基本收入，UBI）。UBI是构建于PoH上的首个应用，旨在以去中心化的方式对每一个人类个体予以奖励。

被称为“以太坊上第一个民主DAO”的UBI DAO（真正做到一人一票）据此建立起来，在UBI DAO发起提案需要消耗$UBI，因此UBI也是该DAO的治理代币。

在更高的层次上，如果PoH得到广泛应用，将有助于催生出所谓“社会区块链”这一概念，它能实现更民主的治理承诺，或大规模地实现UBI的愿景。

**四、PoH与主体唯一性**

在web3，我们通过加密钱包可以调动资金、管理个人档案（平台历史记录），一个账户上能附着多元化价值。而创建一个基于以太坊的账户不需要输入任何个人数据，我们可以几乎零成本地创建无数个账户，每个账户均存在唯一的账户地址。因此，加密市场存在对加密地址进行管理的需求。对此，通过DAS等服务的“反向解析”、Sybil对链上地址映射至数字身份等服务，我们可以将多个地址还原到DID（去中心化身份）一级。

![Figure 4 Comparison between web 2.0 and web 3.0](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/SCh27RcjdYom1n-LOQ0G4.png?height=440&width=936)

在不同的协议中，对于DID的应用程度是不同的。例如，《社交图谱协议 Cyberconnect，拆除了平台、个人和社区的柏林墙》（DragonHorn，2022）一文提到：“（CyberConnect）绕过了验证去中心化身份的问题（用户可以使用小狐狸钱包连接这个网页应用，使用私钥进行签名），而非完整的DID 解决方案。CyberConnect 认的是钱包地址，而非‘人’”。

PoH正是对CyberConnect这一类协议的某种补足：PoH证明机制只认“人”，而非虚虚实实的加密钱包地址。PoH对于完善去中心化身份系统来说不可或缺，人类身份验证与完全匿名的加密地址分处两端，一同构成“光谱”，让用户在此间拥有更多的可选空间。在上述DeFi的应用中我们可以看到，在web3将数据主权交由个体掌握的场景中，使得自己的身份公开可验证，不失为一种取得信任、降低风险溢价成本的方式。

而PoH的意义并不仅限于这些，它更重要的作用是为web3的价值系统提供了一个坚实的自我主体。一个人可以拥有多个加密钱包地址，但这也造成了抽象意义上的主体身份模糊。因为从广义的社会关系上来看，由于“主体”一词的本意包含着唯一性，即主体只有一个；当一切客观存在物都被给予主体性时，多个主体也就可能意味着没有主体。

在区块链网络中，加密钱包地址成为被确认的主体，人退居次要位置，或者说不再是链上的社会经济网络的直接作用对象了。加密地址及其链上的价值记录可以部分反映一个人多变的“社会身份”，但只拥有社会身份是不足以支撑起整个web3 的社会、政治结构的。Cyberspace是从“控制论”变种而来的拟制空间，我们在赛博空间中需要两种身份交替发挥作用：经过认证的“基础身份”用于证明“我是我”（确定为同一社会主体），而多元多变的“社会身份”用于界定或标识“我是谁”。

PoH通过人脸照片、包含语音信息的自拍视频等“基质”来不断接近“主体的唯一性”，这令人想起别尔嘉耶夫在《论人的奴役与自由》中论及“个性”时指出：“人的脸标志着个性及其唯一性、一次性和不可重复性进入世界过程之中。”

人之个性在后工业社会被标准化，成为马尔库塞所言称的“单向度的人”，与之相应的是社会学家乔治·瑞泽尔所形容的“社会麦当劳化”；随着互联网web2.0的发展，它又处于一种奇特的紧张关系中：一方面个性得到充分伸张，另一方面又被数量化，在平台算法与数据贩卖面前逐渐稀薄；如今，web3.0试图让价值与个性回归主权个体——但实质上是回归“节点”（或加密钱包地址）。

通过在匿名化的加密地址与“人”之间建立真实的联系，对此进行去中心化公开验证，PoH及它所代表的人性（人格）证明机制，一方面反驳了web2.0阶段机器学习、算法统摄的“非人格”逻辑，另一方面也为新的、完全参与的对等政治运动和经济开辟道路，为团结经济创造基础，卫护并提升了“人之为人”所具有的意识、选择和代理的价值。

**五、总结**

Proof of Humanity是基于区块链网络与去中心化理念的人类身份证明系统，它在DeFi、NFT、DAO等多个领域都有诸多用例。本文较少在市场、产品层次展开论述，而是倾向于探究其社会学意涵：其与其说PoH是一种反女巫的技术方案与DAPP应用，不如说PoH及其他人格证明（Proof of Personhood）是一种价值与意义工具，桥接了链上社会身份与现实的“人”。如今，去中心化身份系统的意义正日益取得共识，PoH或许能成为我们在广大的加密叙事中确立“主体唯一性”的有效载体。
